Title: Senior SDET I
Description:
Joining Collibra‚Äôs Test Engineering team


You will take part in testing activities in the Scrum Team and assist in the successful execution of testing strategies.
You will develop and promote the testing knowledge within an Agile team and provide the needed help and assistance in enabling developers to test.
You will share your experience on a variety of testing tools relevant to our business environment and drive experimentation towards further improvements.
You will define and maintain metrics and promote testing awareness within Engineering.
You will promote a shift-left approach in testing across Engineering.
You will drive Test Data definition and develop scalable frameworks and tools to solve problems.
This is a hybrid role based in our Brussels office. Our hybrid model means you‚Äôll work from the office at least two days each week. This setup helps us stay connected, work more closely together, and keep making progress as a team.


SDET, Test Engineering at Collibra are responsible for


Reviewing requirement specifications and user stories to provide timely and meaningful feedback.
Designing, development and execution of automation scripts and Test Automation frameworks (Cypress, Playwright, Rest Assured, etc).
Working on the continuous integration of your scripts (Jenkins) and driving the team on the way towards continuous testing.
Identifying, documenting and tracking issues.
Working closely with Software/Test Engineers and Product Managers across the organization to understand the context and drive automation and testing to meet objectives.
Taking part in exploratory testing and test design sessions - to help in improving the overall product quality.
Acquiring a deep understanding of the domain and approach testing holistically, ensuring comprehensive coverage.
Have a critical mindset to discern what to automate and what not to, strategically sampling critical tests with a focus on balancing risk, cost, and value.
Coach developers and other SDETs.
K8s and Helm charts.


You have


Minimum 8 years of experience in Test Automation.
Knowledge of software QA methodologies and tools (JIRA or similar) and processes.
Experience in Java and/or TypeScript and hands-on experience with automated testing tools (Cypress, Playwright, Rest Assured, etc.).
Experience with DevOps, Gradle, Jenkins and Docker.
Good communication skills and enjoy collaborating with fellow co-workers.
Ability to identify flaws in the testing process, toolset, infrastructure and to propose and drive necessary improvements.
A bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent related working experience is required.
You must have work authorization to work in Belgium.


You are


Experienced in building Test Automation Frameworks and in continuous delivery/continuous testing environment.
Experienced in building/maintaining CICD pipelines.
Experienced in working in an Agile/Scrum development process.
Able to identify testing and quality challenges.
Able to create innovative solutions to solve complex problems.
A person with great communication skills and who enjoys collaborating with fellow co-worker.
Able to combine automation skills with manual part of testing (Exploratory).
Able to think independently with curiosity, criticism and keen attention to details.
Well organized and accustomed to an innovative environment.


Measures of success are


Within your first month, you will complete your onboarding and all the mandatory learnings, whilst becoming familiar with the product, tech stack and test frameworks.
Within your third month, you will be actively contributing to the test processes and improvements to test coverage.
Within your sixth month, you will own test projects and be driving the team on quality improvements.


Benefits at Collibra

Collibra recognizes and values that everyone has different needs, interests, and life goals. We built our benefits program with flexibility in mind to support you and your loved ones through a diverse range of circumstances and life events. These flexible offerings sit on a foundation of competitive compensation, health coverage, and time off. Learn more about Collibra‚Äôs benefits.

We create inclusion and belonging through how we onboard, meet, connect, engage, and communicate. Learn more about diversity, equity, and inclusion at Collibra.

At Collibra, we‚Äôre proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We realize the key to creating a company with a world-class culture and employee experience comes from who we hire and creating a workplace that celebrates everyone.

With this, we proudly consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, sex, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, HIV status, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status or any other legally protected category. If you have a need that requires accommodation, let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

HTML:
Joining Collibra‚Äôs Test Engineering team

  • You will take part in testing activities in the Scrum Team and assist in the successful execution of testing strategies.
  • You will develop and promote the testing knowledge within an Agile team and provide the needed help and assistance in enabling developers to test.
  • You will share your experience on a variety of testing tools relevant to our business environment and drive experimentation towards further improvements.
  • You will define and maintain metrics and promote testing awareness within Engineering.
  • You will promote a shift-left approach in testing across Engineering.
  • You will drive Test Data definition and develop scalable frameworks and tools to solve problems.
  • This is a hybrid role based in our Brussels office. Our hybrid model means you‚Äôll work from the office at least two days each week. This setup helps us stay connected, work more closely together, and keep making progress as a team.

SDET, Test Engineering at Collibra are responsible for

  • Reviewing requirement specifications and user stories to provide timely and meaningful feedback.
  • Designing, development and execution of automation scripts and Test Automation frameworks (Cypress, Playwright, Rest Assured, etc).
  • Working on the continuous integration of your scripts (Jenkins) and driving the team on the way towards continuous testing.
  • Identifying, documenting and tracking issues.
  • Working closely with Software/Test Engineers and Product Managers across the organization to understand the context and drive automation and testing to meet objectives.
  • Taking part in exploratory testing and test design sessions - to help in improving the overall product quality.
  • Acquiring a deep understanding of the domain and approach testing holistically, ensuring comprehensive coverage.
  • Have a critical mindset to discern what to automate and what not to, strategically sampling critical tests with a focus on balancing risk, cost, and value.
  • Coach developers and other SDETs.
  • K8s and Helm charts.

You have

  • Minimum 8 years of experience in Test Automation.
  • Knowledge of software QA methodologies and tools (JIRA or similar) and processes.
  • Experience in Java and/or TypeScript and hands-on experience with automated testing tools (Cypress, Playwright, Rest Assured, etc.).
  • Experience with DevOps, Gradle, Jenkins and Docker.
  • Good communication skills and enjoy collaborating with fellow co-workers.
  • Ability to identify flaws in the testing process, toolset, infrastructure and to propose and drive necessary improvements.
  • A bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent related working experience is required.
  • You must have work authorization to work in Belgium.

You are

  • Experienced in building Test Automation Frameworks and in continuous delivery/continuous testing environment.
  • Experienced in building/maintaining CICD pipelines.
  • Experienced in working in an Agile/Scrum development process.
  • Able to identify testing and quality challenges.
  • Able to create innovative solutions to solve complex problems.
  • A person with great communication skills and who enjoys collaborating with fellow co-worker.
  • Able to combine automation skills with manual part of testing (Exploratory).
  • Able to think independently with curiosity, criticism and keen attention to details.
  • Well organized and accustomed to an innovative environment.

Measures of success are

  • Within your first month, you will complete your onboarding and all the mandatory learnings, whilst becoming familiar with the product, tech stack and test frameworks.
  • Within your third month, you will be actively contributing to the test processes and improvements to test coverage.
  • Within your sixth month, you will own test projects and be driving the team on quality improvements.

Title: React developer
HTML:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: React developer

Seniority: Junior/mid-level

Type of position: Hybrid in Brussels

The amazing you, will have:


  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field;
  • 2-4 years of experience as React developer;
  • Experience with state management tools such as Redux or Context API;
  • Solid knowledge of HTML5, CSS3 (SASS or styled-components a plus);
  • Experience with version control (Git) and Agile development environments;
  • Experience with TypeScript is a plus;
  • Familiarity with testing frameworks (e.g., Jest, React Testing Library);
  • Understanding of accessibility and SEO best practices.
  • Experience working with CI/CD pipelines and tools like Docker;
  • Fluent in English or French (mandatory);
  • Dutch is a plus;



Why should you become part of our family?

  • You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term

Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home Full Onsite projects: if you prefer the company of your colleagues! Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psychologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!


Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Innovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Experienced AI Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
YOUR JOB IN A NUTSHELL

As an AI Machine Learning Engineer you promote the adoption of best standards in industrial code development across the Machine Learning and AI community. You do so by developing ML pipelines that are production-ready by design or by integrating existing ML solutions into industrial pipelines.




You participate in the development, deployment and monitoring of AI services, which means you contribute to data quality checks, data flow design, the design of the models themselves and their overall integration into the production environment.




AND IN DETAIL

You facilitate the communication between AI & Analytics teams and IT production with regards to the deployment of ML models, ensuring that models put in production are equipped with the appropriate data pipelines and monitoring.
You work with the Data Scientists to define and develop the target solution with production constraints in mind. This allows to select the correct run infrastructure and serving model (e.g. data ingestion scheme, API synchronicity ‚Ä¶) to address the business requirements (real-time responses, processing volumetry ‚Ä¶).
You contribute to the automation of the different elements of the ML pipeline in order to integrate and deploy them in the production environment (e.g. building Docker/VM images, prepare unitary, regression and integration tests ‚Ä¶).
You support Data Scientists on the usage of the existing industrial solutions available to build and monitor AI services (i.e. the CI/CD tools).
You support IT Production on the parameterization of the target environment.
You ensure that the model runs without errors, is retrained if needed (incl. automatically) and is monitored both from the IT and the business perspective.




YOUR TALENTS AND COMPETENCES




A profound knowledge of English is mandatory. Knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus.




You have at least 3 years of relevant experience with:

Python programming language, including advanced concepts like async programming, and performance optimization
Advanced knowledge of Linux platform, including system administration and troubleshooting
Containerization/virtualization using Docker, Kubernetes
AI platforms & IDEs
CI/CD pipelines using tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD
Code, model & data versioning
Usage of package managing tools and experience in dependency management
PostgreSQL




It is preferable you have experience with:

Integration using different technologies and infra components
Model compression techniques
ELT/ETL tools
Big data tools (Spark)
Data flow processing
Data visualization tools




You have a knowledge of Agile methodology.
You have strong communication skills, oral and written. You are open to other‚Äôs opinions, ideas and feedback.
You work results driven, have attention to detail and you are a real problem solver. You can think out of the box and outside existing processes and frameworks.
You proactively invest time in continuous learning and knowledge improvement.
You work with energy and empowerment to deliver great results and a large contribution to the company‚Äôs success.




WHAT WE HAVE TO OFFER

OUR IMPACT

We strongly believe in the positive impact the financial sector can have on the world. BNP Paribas Fortis offers sustainable and responsible investment products and solutions, and encourages social entrepreneurship. Together with our customers, we work towards a better future every day.




YOUR CAREER PERSPECTIVES

We offer you a wide range of training courses, workshops and webinars to choose from depending on your availability, interests and ambitions.




OUR OFFER

You will benefit from our Smart Working program: offering flexibility on workplace (work everywhere, home working) and time management.




OUR ENGAGEMENT

At BNP Paribas Fortis, we want to attract and retain all talent, whatever their gender, age, background or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether they are living with a disability, as every person has their own experiences and their own identity. All of our full-time vacancies are also open to candidates wishing to work on an 80% or 90% full-time equivalent basis.




If the function is categorized as a banking services provider function (cf. Law of 22 April 2019 establishing an oath and a disciplinary regime for the banking sector), you will also need to provide us with a 'certificate of absence of professional ban' from the FSMA confirming that you are not professionally disqualified.




TEMPTED BY THE CHALLENGE?

A first selection is made based on your CV and motivation letter. Are we convinced that you are the right candidate? Then we will contact you.




Good luck!




Is this position not for you, but do you know someone who is cut out for this job? Feel free to share it with friends and family!

Title: Software Engineer ‚Äì Elixir/Phoenix/LiveView Web Platform
Description:
We're looking for a Software Engineer to join our small, agile team building a modern web platform entirely developed with Elixir, Phoenix, and LiveView.




Our platform helps corporations manage every aspect of their employees' mobility: from ordering and procurement, through daily operations, to HR and financial reporting. Think of it as the central nervous system for company mobility‚Äîstreamlining processes, improving visibility, and making life easier for both employees and management.




You‚Äôll be working alongside a dedicated team of 10 people, a mix of engineers, product thinkers, and domain experts‚Äîsome based in Belgium, others working remotely from abroad. We value autonomy, clean code, and a collaborative mindset.




What you‚Äôll do:

Design and implement new features in a LiveView-first architecture
Work closely with our product team to understand and solve real customer needs
Contribute to the stability, scalability, and performance of the platform
Collaborate in code reviews and technical discussions




What we‚Äôre looking for:

Solid experience with Elixir, Phoenix, and ideally LiveView
Strong grasp of web fundamentals and backend development
Comfortable working independently in a small, remote-friendly team
Pragmatic approach to building maintainable, high-quality software




We offer flexible working conditions, with the option to combine remote work it with in-person collaboration at our base in Belgium.




Join us in shaping the future of corporate mobility tech‚Äîone line of clean Elixir code at a time.




Interested? Let‚Äôs talk.

Title: Backend Junior Software Engineer - Remote 4 days a week (Europe)
Description:
About Us

Gr4vy (pronounced Gravy), is a "no-code" cloud payments orchestration platform. Gr4vy‚Äôs mission is to become the platform-of-choice by which all retailers deploy payment infrastructure around the world. Founded by former PayPal fintech leaders, Gr4vy is set to disrupt the $4 Trillion global retail payment space by removing the complexity of merchants running their own payment infrastructure.

Having both raised a total of $27.2M in funding and nearly doubling our valuation in less than a year, it‚Äôs an exciting time to join the engineering team of this innovative B2B startup. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to build with the best in the industry while driving Gr4vy‚Äôs product marketing strategy from the ground up.

About The Role

Software Engineers at Gr4vy collaborate across product, engineering, design, and other stakeholders. We work in short two week sprints & regularly share, reflect on and iterate on our work.

Our platform uses Python and the FastAPI framework along with React and Typescript for most of our frontend. We use unit, integration and acceptance tests to drive design and keep everything working.

Key Responsibilities


You actively contribute to the team's projects and follow best coding practices.
You are open to learning new design patterns for backend tasks.
You have influence over the tasks within your immediate team.
You work with the product manager to ensure understanding of tasks.
You work with support from senior engineers to better understand problems and solutions.
You review PRs from peers to better understand how others are implementing solutions.


Requirements

We‚Äôre looking for developers with practical experience and knowledge with coding, testing, and debugging in Python.

Why you‚Äôll love working at Gr4vy

You‚Äôll be joining at a truly momentous time in our company‚Äôs life cycle. We want your imprint on how the world experiences Gr4vy as the leader in the fast-growing cloud payments space. Come and bring your skills to a growing team of 11. You‚Äôll influence, challenge and help build our inclusive culture and passion for equity. A global identity is in Gr4vy‚Äôs DNA, with employees currently spanning Europe and the San Francisco Bay Area.

Our Fine Print

We choose laughter first. Sometimes our standups veer into debates about food, family (furballs included), and unlimited lifehack fails. We‚Äôre committed to learning, to advocating, and to doing better for our customers and ourselves, every day.

Diversity statement

We value all the great benefits that diversity brings and encourage everyone to bring their whole self at work, regardless of gender, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age or disability.

Need some extra context? Read about us in this recent Crunchbase exclusive.

Compensation: Competitive salary in USD + equity + benefits Location: Anywhere in Europe - Remote working.

Title: Experienced scientist ‚Äì Standards for clinical data capture and exchange
Description:
Sciensano verbindt gezondheid, wetenschap en samenleving en telt meer dan 900 medewerkers die zich elke dag opnieuw inzetten voor de gezondheid van mens en dier. Zoals uit onze naam blijkt, vormen wetenschap en gezondheid de kern van ons bestaan. De kracht van Sciensano ligt in de holistische en multidisciplinaire benadering van gezondheid. Onze aandacht gaat daarbij uit naar het nauwe en onlosmakelijke verband tussen de gezondheid van mensen en die van dieren, en hun omgeving (het ‚ÄúOne health‚Äù concept). Daarom combineren we meerdere invalshoeken in ons onderzoek om op een unieke manier bij te dragen aan ieders gezondheid. Sciensano kan hiervoor verder bouwen op de meer dan 100 jaar wetenschappelijke expertise van het voormalige Centrum voor Onderzoek in Diergeneeskunde en Agrochemie (CODA) en het vroegere Wetenschappelijk Instituut Volksgezondheid (WIV). Voor meer informatie over onze projecten en activiteiten : https://www.sciensano.be.




FUNCTIE

Sciensano biedt verschillende vacante jobs aan. We zijn momenteel op zoek naar een Experienced scientist ‚Äì Standards for clinical data capture and exchange (BE READY NOW)

Je versterkt het Platform for Interventional Studies (Wetenschappelijk directie Infectieziekten Mens). Deze wetenschappelijke eenheid richt zich op het initi√´ren en ondersteunen van methodologisch rigoureus interventieonderzoek om de volksgezondheid te bevorderen en voorbereid te zijn in het geval van gezondheidscrises. Het platform faciliteert de uitvoering van onafhankelijke studies samen met interne en externe partners.

Je werkt specifiek op het BE READY NOW-project, een initiatief om het Europese partnerschap te versterken bij de voorbereiding op toekomstige pandemie√´n, met als doel een veerkrachtig onderzoeks- en innovatie-ecosysteem op te bouwen dat klaar is om toekomstige gezondheidscrises i.v.m. infectieziekten het hoofd te bieden.

Je taken omvatten onder andere:

het beheer en de co√∂rdinatie van het werkpakket gegevensbeheer binnen dit Europse project;
de ontwikkeling en implementatie van een kader voor harmonisatie en standaardisatie van gegevens: d.i. het verzamelen, verwerken en delen van informatie, incl. het defini√´ren van plannen voor gegevensbeheer voor versterking van de paraatheid bij pandemie√´n;
de supervisie van de implementatie van een platform voor het deponeren en delen van gegevens (met inachtname van de FAIR-principes) in overeenstemming met de European Open Science Cloud (EOSC) en de European Health Data Space (EHDS);
de rapportage m.b.t. het project.

Je krijgt de kans om een sleutelrol te spelen in een groot Europees project.




PROFIEL

Master in biomedische wetenschappen (of ander diploma relevant voor het onderzoeksgebied)
Bij voorkeur een doctoraat in Public Health Sciences of Biomedische Wetenschappen (of minimaal 4 jaar relevante ervaring)
Ervaring in projectmanagement in een Europese context of partners
Zeer goede kennis van goede klinische praktijken (GCP/GCP)
Zeer goede kennis van gegevensbeheer, vertrouwelijkheid en beveiliging van gegevens, General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)
Ervaring met FAIR-principe en gegevensinteroperabiliteit
Generieke competenties: analytische en probleemoplossende competenties; aandacht voor detail; streven naar voortdurende verbetering; in team te werken; georganiseerd.
Taalvaardigheden: uitstekende kennis van Engels (gesproken en geschreven) en Nederlands of Frans




AANBOD

Een voltijdse arbeidsovereenkomst in een gerenommeerd wetenschappelijk instituut

Een transparant en duidelijk vastgesteld loon : klasse SW2 (op voorwaarde dat u voldoet aan de voorwaarden, zie profiel)

Een waaier aan voordelen : groeps-/hospitalisatieverzekering, ruim aantal verlofdagen, maaltijdcheques, interessante extra‚Äôs met de federale voordeelkaart (Fed+)

Een werkgever gericht op duurzaamheid : 100% terugbetaling van je woon-werkverkeer met het openbaar vervoer (betaald abonnement openbaar vervoer)

Interessante werkcondities : Mogelijkheid tot telewerken/ glijdende uren in een 38-uren werkweek

Een stimulerende werkomgeving : verschillende opleidingsmogelijkheden (via een online leeromgeving (SciensanoAcademy), mogelijkheden om onsite trainingen te volgen tijdens je werkuren, en nog veel meer




CONTACT

Stuur snel je kandidatuur in via onze website https://www.sciensano.be voor 5 mei.

Heb je vragen omtrent deze functie of wens je bijkomende informatie?

Contacteer ons via jobs@sciensano.be.

De volgende stappen

1¬∞ je kandidatuur wordt door de recruiter en de dienst grondig onderzocht,

2¬∞ je ontvangt een e-mail met onze beslissing, genomen op basis van je cv en motivatiebrief, en het gepubliceerde profiel en de noden van de dienst,

3¬∞ en indien je kandidatuur positief is beoordeeld, word je tijdig uitgenodigd voor een gesprek.

HTML:
Sciensano verbindt gezondheid, wetenschap en samenleving en telt meer dan 900 medewerkers die zich elke dag opnieuw inzetten voor de gezondheid van mens en dier. Zoals uit onze naam blijkt, vormen wetenschap en gezondheid de kern van ons bestaan. De kracht van Sciensano ligt in de holistische en multidisciplinaire benadering van gezondheid. Onze aandacht gaat daarbij uit naar het nauwe en onlosmakelijke verband tussen de gezondheid van mensen en die van dieren, en hun omgeving (het ‚ÄúOne health‚Äù concept). Daarom combineren we meerdere invalshoeken in ons onderzoek om op een unieke manier bij te dragen aan ieders gezondheid. Sciensano kan hiervoor verder bouwen op de meer dan 100 jaar wetenschappelijke expertise van het voormalige Centrum voor Onderzoek in Diergeneeskunde en Agrochemie (CODA) en het vroegere Wetenschappelijk Instituut Volksgezondheid (WIV). Voor meer informatie over onze projecten en activiteiten : https://www.sciensano.be.


FUNCTIE

Sciensano biedt verschillende vacante jobs aan. We zijn momenteel op zoek naar een Experienced scientist ‚Äì Standards for clinical data capture and exchange (BE READY NOW)

Je versterkt het Platform for Interventional Studies (Wetenschappelijk directie Infectieziekten Mens). Deze wetenschappelijke eenheid richt zich op het initi√´ren en ondersteunen van methodologisch rigoureus interventieonderzoek om de volksgezondheid te bevorderen en voorbereid te zijn in het geval van gezondheidscrises. Het platform faciliteert de uitvoering van onafhankelijke studies samen met interne en externe partners.

Je werkt specifiek op het BE READY NOW-project, een initiatief om het Europese partnerschap te versterken bij de voorbereiding op toekomstige pandemie√´n, met als doel een veerkrachtig onderzoeks- en innovatie-ecosysteem op te bouwen dat klaar is om toekomstige gezondheidscrises i.v.m. infectieziekten het hoofd te bieden.

Je taken omvatten onder andere:

  • het beheer en de co√∂rdinatie van het werkpakket gegevensbeheer binnen dit Europse project;
  • de ontwikkeling en implementatie van een kader voor harmonisatie en standaardisatie van gegevens: d.i. het verzamelen, verwerken en delen van informatie, incl. het defini√´ren van plannen voor gegevensbeheer voor versterking van de paraatheid bij pandemie√´n;
  • de supervisie van de implementatie van een platform voor het deponeren en delen van gegevens (met inachtname van de FAIR-principes) in overeenstemming met de European Open Science Cloud (EOSC) en de European Health Data Space (EHDS);
  • de rapportage m.b.t. het project.

Je krijgt de kans om een sleutelrol te spelen in een groot Europees project.


PROFIEL

  • Master in biomedische wetenschappen (of ander diploma relevant voor het onderzoeksgebied)
  • Bij voorkeur een doctoraat in Public Health Sciences of Biomedische Wetenschappen (of minimaal 4 jaar relevante ervaring)
  • Ervaring in projectmanagement in een Europese context of partners
  • Zeer goede kennis van goede klinische praktijken (GCP/GCP)
  • Zeer goede kennis van gegevensbeheer, vertrouwelijkheid en beveiliging van gegevens, General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)
  • Ervaring met FAIR-principe en gegevensinteroperabiliteit
  • Generieke competenties: analytische en probleemoplossende competenties; aandacht voor detail; streven naar voortdurende verbetering; in team te werken; georganiseerd.
  • Taalvaardigheden: uitstekende kennis van Engels (gesproken en geschreven) en Nederlands of Frans


AANBOD

Een voltijdse arbeidsovereenkomst in een gerenommeerd wetenschappelijk instituut

Een transparant en duidelijk vastgesteld loon : klasse SW2 (op voorwaarde dat u voldoet aan de voorwaarden, zie profiel)

Een waaier aan voordelen : groeps-/hospitalisatieverzekering, ruim aantal verlofdagen, maaltijdcheques, interessante extra‚Äôs met de federale voordeelkaart (Fed+)

Een werkgever gericht op duurzaamheid : 100% terugbetaling van je woon-werkverkeer met het openbaar vervoer (betaald abonnement openbaar vervoer)

Interessante werkcondities : Mogelijkheid tot telewerken/ glijdende uren in een 38-uren werkweek

Een stimulerende werkomgeving : verschillende opleidingsmogelijkheden (via een online leeromgeving (SciensanoAcademy), mogelijkheden om onsite trainingen te volgen tijdens je werkuren, en nog veel meer


CONTACT

Stuur snel je kandidatuur in via onze website https://www.sciensano.be voor 5 mei.

Heb je vragen omtrent deze functie of wens je bijkomende informatie?

Contacteer ons via jobs@sciensano.be.

De volgende stappen

1¬∞ je kandidatuur wordt door de recruiter en de dienst grondig onderzocht,

2¬∞ je ontvangt een e-mail met onze beslissing, genomen op basis van je cv en motivatiebrief, en het gepubliceerde profiel en de noden van de dienst,

3¬∞ en indien je kandidatuur positief is beoordeeld, word je tijdig uitgenodigd voor een gesprek.

Title: AI & ML Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,200 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 15 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

Are you passionate about AI and eager to drive innovation in a fast-paced, impact-driven environment? Do you have experience developing AI-powered applications and enjoy mentoring others? If so, we invite you to join Nexthink as an AI & ML Engineer!

As a key member of our AI team, you will design, develop, and deploy scalable AI solutions, leveraging cutting-edge technologies to enhance digital employee experiences for millions worldwide.

Responsibilities


Lead AI Development ‚Äì Design and implement AI-powered products, with a strong focus on Agentic systems.
LLMs done right ‚Äì Create evaluations and define metrics of success using cutting edge AI platforms.
MLOps - Implement and manage MLOps practices to streamline the deployment, monitoring, and maintenance of models and in production environments.
Collaboration & Leadership ‚Äì Work closely with software engineers, data scientists, and product teams to align AI capabilities with business needs.
Mentorship & Coaching ‚Äì Guide and support junior AI engineers, fostering a culture of learning and knowledge sharing


Qualifications


BSc/MSc degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
Hands-on experience in LLM-powered production applications.
Strong proficiency in Python and AI frameworks (e.g., LangChain, PyTorch).
Proven experience with AWS and cloud-based AI deployments.
Solid understanding of AI model fine-tuning, optimization, and evaluation.
Knowledge of reinforcement learning, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and multi-agent AI architectures.
Strong data intuition: ability to inspect raw logs, design metrics, and quickly identify quality regressions
Hands-on experience with MLOps: reproducible pipelines, automated evaluations, feature stores, CI/CD for models or prompt/embedding configs
Familiarity with MLOps best practices for deploying and monitoring AI models in production.
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Eagerness to learn and adapt
Strong communication skills in English, capable of explaining complex AI concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders - we believe in learning by sharing.


If you‚Äôre excited about pushing the boundaries of AI and mentoring the next generation of engineers, we‚Äôd love to hear from you! Even if you don‚Äôt meet every requirement, we encourage you to apply‚Äîwe value expertise, passion, and the drive to learn.

Additional Information

We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers‚Äô IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.

With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‚ÄòNexthinkers‚Äô and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:


üíº Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (including stock options).
üìç Very good location next to the Prilly-Malley train station.
üè° Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.
üèñÔ∏è Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 25 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.
ü§∏ Free access to a fitness centre inside the building.
üöû Reimbursement of the half-fare travel card for public transport.
üßë‚Äçüè´ Reimbursement up to 50% of the cost of French classes.
üçâ Fresh fruit, cookies, and soft drinks as well.
ü§ù Regular company and team events like Voluntary Days, Pizza talks, Team Building activities, hosting Meetups at the office and more!
üì£ Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment.
üöö We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country.


Please note that not all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Overview

At Hilo by Aktiia, we believe the key to improving cardiovascular health is to provide patients and physicians with a deeper understanding of the blood pressure pattern. Before Hilo, it was not possible to monitor cardiovascular health at scale.

We are an early-stage, venture-backed start-up that has raised over $96M from top-tier investors in Europe and the United States. We have developed and brought to market the world's first continuous blood pressure monitor. Our technology is based on 18 years of research by our founders at the prestigious Swiss Center for Electronics and Microtechnology (CSEM). Hilo by Aktiia's solution has been validated through extensive clinical trials and received a CE Mark as a Class IIa medical device under MDR leading to commercial access of approximately 43 countries worldwide.

To strengthen our team, we are looking for a:

ML ENGINEER

Responsibilities


Design, develop, optimize, and document innovative AI models for blood pressure estimation from optical signals
Analyze model limitations and devise strategies to enhance performance, addressing key challenges
Collaborate and communicate effectively with cross-functional teams to solve complex technical problems



Your profile


M.Sc or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, or a relevant field
5+ years of industry experience applying Deep Learning techniques
Experience in developing, fine-tuning, and evaluating neural network architectures on large-scale datasets
Experience in performing verification and validation (V&V) activities of developed models
Experience in deploying machine learning models in a production environment
Deep understanding of statistical learning, CNNs, and RNNs
Proficiency in Python and machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, etc.)
Experience in medical signal processing or time series analysis is a plus
Strong communication skills in English (both written and spoken)
Creative and hands-on approach to problem-solving
Comfortable working in a multidisciplinary, multicultural, and diversity-oriented team
Highly organized and meticulous in code development and documentation, ensuring thorough traceability and clarity in compliance with medical device industry standards
Based in Switzerland, with a valid Swiss work permit


Are you passionate in solving problems with visionaries and innovative approaches? In this case you are ready to rock with the Hilo team. We look forward to receiving your application by email (D2DD945FC7@jobs.workablemail.com).

Only fully documented applications (CV, diplomas) will be considered for the recruitment process. If you should not hear back from us within two weeks, your application has unfortunately not been successful for this role.

Benefits


Pension
Competitive compensation package based on experience
Flexible work location (hybrid work schedule) and occasional international travel as required (10% of time)

Title: Junior AI Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the global leader in digital employee experience management. Our products allow enterprises to create highly productive digital workplaces for their employees by delivering optimal end-user experiences. Through a unique combination of real-time analytics, automation and employee feedback, Nexthink gives IT teams the insight they need to empower people at work.

Headquartered in Switzerland with US headquarters in Boston, Nexthink also has offices in France, UK, Germany, Spain and UAE. Our growing team of Nexthinkers is proud to be making the digital work lives of nearly ten million employees across 1,000 customers more productive.

At Nexthink, we believe actions are stronger than words when it comes to diversity, inclusivity, and equity in the workplace. Nexthinkers are multinational and multilingual, and come from all walks of life. We are committed to hiring a genuinely representative workforce that can create solutions and foster innovation for the modern digital employee experience. Join us today!

Job Description

We are seeking a Junior AI Engineer with foundational knowledge in AI, GenAI, and Machine Learning. You will join one of our AI teams and assist them in prototyping, maturing, and shipping AI features to a production-ready level.

You are a pragmatic, results-driven engineer who is eager to learn and understands modern AI stacks but thinks in terms of software reliability, performance, and user impact. You focus on creating scalable, observable solutions that solve real-world problems for our customers.

Because the role is cross-functional, the ability to communicate complex concepts in simple ways is essential. You will collaborate with product, design, front-end, and infrastructure teams to bring delightful AI features to life.

Responsibilities

As part of the AI team at Nexthink, you will:


Assist in implementing new AI features with high-quality coding standards and automated test coverage.
Support solving the engineering challenges behind data collection, retrieval, evaluation, and inference at scale.
Help build and maintain CI/CD pipelines for AI components, ensuring safe, repeatable deployments.
Instrument robust online/offline evaluation metrics and dashboards to monitor quality in production.
Proactively propose new product capabilities or improvements based on user data and technology advances.
Stay current with the rapidly evolving AI engineering ecosystem and share knowledge with the Nexthink community.
Communicate effectively with (non-technical) stakeholders such as product managers and UX designers.


Qualifications


BSc/MSc in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related field
0-3 years of professional software-engineering experience, including internships or projects.
Basic experience in integrating with LLMs (e.g., Prompting, Evaluation, Observability).
Demonstrated interest in delivering AI-powered features that serve real users at scale (e.g., retrieval-augmented search, Generative AI assistants, predictive analytics).
Fluency in Python or at least one strongly-typed language (TypeScript or Java), with clean-code and testing discipline.
Understanding of cloud-native architectures (AWS or comparable), containerisation (Docker), and orchestration (Kubernetes / ECS).
Hands-on experience with MLOps: reproducible pipelines, automated evaluations, feature stores, CI/CD for models or prompt/embedding configs.
Strong data intuition: ability to inspect raw logs, design metrics, and quickly identify quality regressions.
Product mindset and empathy for end-users; able to translate fuzzy product requirements into incremental engineering plans.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills in English (spoken & written).


If you‚Äôre excited about joing one of the top companies working on AI and pushing the boundaries of AI we‚Äôd love to hear from you! Even if you don‚Äôt meet every requirement, we encourage you to apply‚Äîwe value expertise, passion, and the drive to learn.

Additional Information

We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers‚Äô IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.

With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‚ÄòNexthinkers‚Äô and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:

üíº Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (including stock options).

üìç Very good location next to the Prilly-Malley train station.

üè° Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.

üèñÔ∏è Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 25 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.

HTML:
Company Description

Nexthink is the global leader in digital employee experience management. Our products allow enterprises to create highly productive digital workplaces for their employees by delivering optimal end-user experiences. Through a unique combination of real-time analytics, automation and employee feedback, Nexthink gives IT teams the insight they need to empower people at work.

Headquartered in Switzerland with US headquarters in Boston, Nexthink also has offices in France, UK, Germany, Spain and UAE. Our growing team of Nexthinkers is proud to be making the digital work lives of nearly ten million employees across 1,000 customers more productive.

At Nexthink, we believe actions are stronger than words when it comes to diversity, inclusivity, and equity in the workplace. Nexthinkers are multinational and multilingual, and come from all walks of life. We are committed to hiring a genuinely representative workforce that can create solutions and foster innovation for the modern digital employee experience. Join us today!

Job Description

We are seeking a Junior AI Engineer with foundational knowledge in AI, GenAI, and Machine Learning. You will join one of our AI teams and assist them in prototyping, maturing, and shipping AI features to a production-ready level.

You are a pragmatic, results-driven engineer who is eager to learn and understands modern AI stacks but thinks in terms of software reliability, performance, and user impact. You focus on creating scalable, observable solutions that solve real-world problems for our customers.

Because the role is cross-functional, the ability to communicate complex concepts in simple ways is essential. You will collaborate with product, design, front-end, and infrastructure teams to bring delightful AI features to life.

Responsibilities

As part of the AI team at Nexthink, you will:

  • Assist in implementing new AI features with high-quality coding standards and automated test coverage.
  • Support solving the engineering challenges behind data collection, retrieval, evaluation, and inference at scale.
  • Help build and maintain CI/CD pipelines for AI components, ensuring safe, repeatable deployments.
  • Instrument robust online/offline evaluation metrics and dashboards to monitor quality in production.
  • Proactively propose new product capabilities or improvements based on user data and technology advances.
  • Stay current with the rapidly evolving AI engineering ecosystem and share knowledge with the Nexthink community.
  • Communicate effectively with (non-technical) stakeholders such as product managers and UX designers.

Qualifications

  • BSc/MSc in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related field
  • 0-3 years of professional software-engineering experience, including internships or projects.
  • Basic experience in integrating with LLMs (e.g., Prompting, Evaluation, Observability).
  • Demonstrated interest in delivering AI-powered features that serve real users at scale (e.g., retrieval-augmented search, Generative AI assistants, predictive analytics).
  • Fluency in Python or at least one strongly-typed language (TypeScript or Java), with clean-code and testing discipline.
  • Understanding of cloud-native architectures (AWS or comparable), containerisation (Docker), and orchestration (Kubernetes / ECS).
  • Hands-on experience with MLOps: reproducible pipelines, automated evaluations, feature stores, CI/CD for models or prompt/embedding configs.
  • Strong data intuition: ability to inspect raw logs, design metrics, and quickly identify quality regressions.
  • Product mindset and empathy for end-users; able to translate fuzzy product requirements into incremental engineering plans.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills in English (spoken & written).

If you‚Äôre excited about joing one of the top companies working on AI and pushing the boundaries of AI we‚Äôd love to hear from you! Even if you don‚Äôt meet every requirement, we encourage you to apply‚Äîwe value expertise, passion, and the drive to learn.

Additional Information

We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers‚Äô IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.

With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‚ÄòNexthinkers‚Äô and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:

üíº Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (including stock options).

üìç Very good location next to the Prilly-Malley train station.

üè° Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.

üèñÔ∏è Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 25 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.

üöû Reimbursement of the half-fare travel card for public transport.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Sigma Suisse is seeking for it's client, a company in the trading sector, a Data Scientist with experience in the physical world : commodity industry, transportation or logistics :




We are seeking a skilled professional to join our client's team specializing in data science and machine learning. This role involves collaboration with various departments, including technical experts, software developers, and business teams, to develop and implement advanced analytical models and applications.




The position spans multiple areas such as trading, operational processes, and other supporting functions, requiring adaptability to diverse technologies and stakeholder needs. The selected candidate will be involved in every stage of project development, from defining objectives with stakeholders to data preparation, exploratory analysis, model optimization, and deployment of production-ready solutions.




This role demands a hands-on approach to handling complex datasets and delivering actionable insights. The candidate will join a group of experienced professionals focused on addressing significant challenges within the energy sector while exploring innovative possibilities for improvement.




Job Description




Apply data science to development applications in the commodities trading sector
Design and implement optimization, improvement, and automation solutions for trading applications
Analyze data related to physical movements (vessel locations, etc.) in the commodities industry
Develop models and analyses to extract insights from physical world data
Collaborate closely with the software development team to create clean and modular code
Participate in the continuous improvement of existing trading applications




Qualifications




Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related field
5 to 10 years of experience in data science, ideally in the commodities sector
Strong skills in mathematics, statistics, and machine learning
Advanced proficiency in Python and ability to write clean, modular, and well-documented code
Proven experience analyzing data related to the physical world (transportation, logistics, etc.)
Ability to translate complex problems into effective technical solutions
Knowledge of the commodities sector and trading applications is a significant advantage
Experience in C# development appreciated but not mandatory

Title: Data Scientist / Analyst
Description:
CLEEVEN, a technology consulting firm, was built on two strong convictions:

The excellence of European engineers must ensure global competitiveness

Our human mission: to support our employees in their personal development.




As part of a strategic project with one of our Swiss clients in the pharmaceutical sector, we are recruiting a Data Scientist / Data Analyst (M/F) with a background in life sciences (pharmacy, biology, medical devices...) to support the teams in the collection, analysis, and interpretation of health data related to the development of new components and medical devices.




Role and responsibilities:

Work closely with R&D, clinical, and quality teams to structure and analyze data from preclinical and clinical studies
Analyze health-related data (efficacy, tolerance, side effects‚Ä¶) to support medical and regulatory decision-making
Design statistical or machine learning models to extract insights from domain-specific data
Ensure data quality: cleaning, structuring, and documentation of datasets
Build dashboards and reports to communicate results to non-technical stakeholders
Contribute to the preparation of technical documentation for regulatory submissions




Expected skills:

Excellent command of data analysis tools: Python (Pandas, Scikit-learn...), R, or SAS
Strong understanding of regulated environments (GxP, pharmacovigilance, medical devices...)
Experience working with biomedical or clinical databases
Knowledge of data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, matplotlib, etc.)
Ability to translate complex analytical results into actionable insights for medical or regulatory teams
Experience in pharma, biotech, or medtech environments is a strong plus




Profile:

Engineering degree, Master‚Äôs or PhD in pharmacy, biostatistics, data science, or related field
Prior experience in data science or analytics applied to healthcare
Strong analytical skills, scientific rigor, and autonomy
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work cross-functionally (medical, data, IT teams)
Fluent in English, German and French are a big plus
Valid administrative situation to work in Switzerland




See you soon,

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Research Engineer
Description:
Our Computational Sciences group is a team of machine-learning engineers, computational chemists, and drug-discovery scientists. We build in-silico tools that let our Medicinal-Chemistry and Biology colleagues make faster, smarter decisions throughout hit-finding, hit-to-lead, and lead-optimization.

We‚Äôre searching for research engineers who love creating algorithms, models, and systems that unlock value in small-molecule drug-discovery workflows and advance the state-of-the-art in ML for chemistry.




Key qualifications:




Hands-on deep-learning expertise with a focus on molecular-representation learning: graph neural networks (GNNs), 3-D transformers, diffusion/flow models, or large language models for chemistry (e.g., SELFIES/SMILES transformers).
Solid technical foundations in mathematics and statistics;
Proficient programming skills in Python and one or more of the ML frameworks such as PyTorch, Tensorflow, and JAX;
Familiarity with MLOps & DevOps (Docker, Git, CI/CD, experiment tracking, cloud computer).
Ability to work in a collaborative environment across different geographical regions;




What you'll do:




We have seen that machine learning methods applied to problems in protein engineering can genuinely be impactful. Furthermore, these in-silico methods can be even more rewarding, when they are put to the test in our lab as part of our drug development programs. You will be working in a team of talented and driven engineers and scientists, who are striving to make a difference in drug development and open to applying novel techniques in order to contribute to our understanding of some of the most relevant areas of protein science.




The role mainly involves:




Design novel ML/AI algorithms for small-molecule tasks e.g., property prediction, binding-affinity estimation, activity cliffs, ADME/Tox, and generative molecule design.
Integrate physics-based methods with data-driven models to build hybrid, end-to-end pipelines.
Build & own our chemistry-focused MLOps stack, taking models from research to robust production services.
Explore blue-sky research directions while balancing near-term program needs.
Collaborate closely with medicinal chemists and biologists, translating model insights into tangible design hypotheses and experimental campaigns.
Communicate results to technical and non-technical stakeholders papers, internal seminars, open-source contributions, and conference talks.




Education & Experience:




PhD (or MS + 2 yrs experience) in Computer Science, Computational Chemistry, Cheminformatics, Chemical Engineering, Applied Physics, or a related field.
Publications, patents, open-source repos, or shipped products demonstrating impact in AI-for-chemistry or computational drug discovery are highly valued.




The role could be either based in Switzerland, the UK or the US.










We inform you that your personal data will be processed according to the applicable Data Protection Law. The Data Controller is¬†Peptone Switzerland AG,¬†which will process your personal data for employee recruitment purposes. To view the extended information notice, please select the 'apply to position' link here above.

Title: Trainee - Artificial Intelligence & Data
Description:
Job Description

Location: Zurich, Geneva

Work Pattern Percentage: 80% - 100%

You bring ambition, we provide opportunities.

Help our clients navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices

Are you close to completing a bachelor / master's in science, Information Technology, or a related quantitative discipline, eager to dive into the world of Artificial Intelligence and Data? Our AI & Data team is on the lookout for passionate, innovative minds ready to explore the vast possibilities of AI and data analytics. As a trainee with us, you will embark on a journey of learning and discovery, gaining hands-on experience in shaping the future of technology. Join us to transform your academic knowledge into real-world impact, and kickstart your career in one of the most exciting and fast-evolving fields today.

About The Position

We are looking for Trainees starting September 2025 for a 12-month program. Top performers may be offered full-time roles as Business Analysts or Consultants right after the program or within a year of finishing studies.

How You Can Make An Impact


Work with our clients to modernize their data landscape using next generation cloud-enabled platforms and (Gen)AI technology to deliver high quality actionable insights
Implement large-scale data ecosystems including data management, governance, and the integration of internal and external data
Leverage traditional data visualization and next generation algorithms to generate predictions and insights from structured and unstructured data, and augment decision-making
Jointly develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their objectives ranging from satisfying regulatory requirements to improving customer experience by leveraging the power of modern data stack
Guide clients in executing complex data transformations that have organizational and cultural implications and require data-driven mindset



Who We Are Looking For


You have a strong academic background, preferably with a degree in Science, Information Technology, or another quantitative field
You have a strong drive for excellence and high career ambitions
You have gained first relevant practical data-related and/or consulting-like experience through internships/traineeships and enjoy working methodically and with great attention to detail.
You grasp new concepts quickly and are both client and goal oriented
You can manage multiple activities and are used to work in high pace environment
You‚Äôre fluent English, fluency in German and/or French highly preferred
You show a foundational understanding of at least one of the following disciplines ‚Äì data management, data platforms, data analytics & (Gen)AI
Practical experience with SQL, Python/Spark, GenI, and Cloud Data Platforms is highly beneficial



Your Team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 60+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices.‚ÄØWe specialise in AI & Data ‚Äì empowering clients to harness it for creating human-centric solutions, driving growth and efficiency. Clients benefit from our expertise in data, analytics, modern platforms, and advanced technologies like Generative AI. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Careers at Deloitte. Choose your impact.

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on ‚Äúapply now‚Äù to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates. If you have any questions, please contact Jules at talent@deloitte.ch


We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria; don‚Äôt hold yourself back ‚Äì apply today.



We do not accept applications from recruitment agencies for this position.

Deloitte Consulting AG and Deloitte AG are affiliates of Deloitte NSE LLP, a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee (‚ÄúDTTL‚Äù)

Requisition ID: 17999

Title: Data Scientist in Sustainability
Description:
Why you'll love Quantis

For nearly two decades, our dynamic and visionary team has partnered with organizations across the globe to transform their industries and pave the way for a planetary economy that aligns business with nature. We strive to be agents of change, helping companies transform from business as usual to business at its best.

We believe that sustainable transformation is possible and within our power. We're contributing to this transformation by combining the latest science with strategic business insights. Our advice enables global leaders in the consumer goods and finance industries to understand how to reduce their environmental impacts, implement change successfully, and operate within planetary boundaries.

Motivated by this common purpose, our 300+ talented professionals cultivate a unique, collaborative culture that we call the Quantis Spirit. We are innovative. We are impact-oriented. We are science-based. We are Quantis.

Join us!

Quantis is a leading sustainability consultancy dedicated to pioneering solutions for critical environmental challenges. We empower businesses to understand and reduce their environmental footprint through advanced data-driven insights.

As a Data Scientist at Quantis, you will contribute to the development of digital products and Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) databases. Your work will support global companies in measuring, understanding, and reducing their environmental impact.

Joining the Quantis data team means...


Actively contribute to the evolution of Quantis LCA databases, by developing approaches for data collection, manipulation, processing, and maintenance.
Collaborate closely with LCA specialists and environmental engineers, ensuring rigorous scientific accuracy.
Develop deep sector-specific data expertise in our priority industries: food & beverage, apparel, and cosmetics.
Engage directly with leading sustainability professionals and leverage their insights to build impactful data solutions.



Does this describe you?


You are passionate and driven to use your technical and analytical expertise to advance global sustainability and align businesses with Planetary Boundaries.
You hold a Master's degree (or higher) in Data Science, Environmental Engineering, Computer Science, or a closely related field.‚ÄØ
You have robust data manipulation skills and a proven track record of building data-driven models and applications.
You are proficient in Python, enthusiastic about AI and machine learning, and actively exploring innovative applications of LLMs and related technologies.
You excel at working with structured and semi-structured data sets and enjoy transforming complex data into meaningful insights.
You have excellent interpersonal and communication skills, able to clearly present complex analytical concepts to diverse audiences.
You thrive in collaborative team environments, providing technical guidance, mentoring colleagues, and contributing to team growth.
You communicate clearly and confidently in fluent English; proficiency in French would be an advantage.



Additional nice-to-have knowledge:


You have prior experience or substantial familiarity with Life Cycle Assessment (LCA).
You possess knowledge in agricultural modeling or other sustainability-focused sectors.


Join us and be part of a dedicated team committed to making a tangible impact on environmental sustainability through advanced data science.

Some logistics to consider


Location: Lausanne or Z√ºrich
Optimal start date: as soon as possible
Frequent collaboration with other Quantis branches (Boston, Paris, Berlin, and Milan) via web-conferences or in-person
Ability to travel occasionally for internal meetings


Quantis has a distinctive, fluid structure nurtured by our Quantis Spirit and our way of collaborating that provides a positive and unique working environment. Salary will be determined based on potential for contribution to the organization's success.

Quantis Diversity-Equity-Inclusion Statement

At Quantis, the principles of DEI have always been an essential part of our identity, our values and our mission. Our commitment is to elevate the voices of all Quantisians to foster an inclusive culture where all employees feel that they belong and are valued. Our goal is to create a workforce that reflects the diversity of all the places where we live and work. This extends to our clients, their clients, and their entire value chain as sustainable thinking and collective representation are integral components of our purpose to transform the way that businesses operate.

At Quantis, the principles of DEI have always been an essential part of our identity, our values and our mission. Our commitment is to elevate the voices of all Quantisians to foster an inclusive culture where all employees feel that they belong and are valued. Our goal is to create a workforce that reflects the diversity of all the places where we live and work. This extends to our clients, their clients, and their entire value chain as sustainable thinking and collective representation are integral components of our purpose to transform the way that businesses operate.

Title: Trainee - Artificial Intelligence & Data
Description:
Job Description

Location: Zurich, Geneva

Work Pattern Percentage: 80% - 100%

You bring ambition, we provide opportunities.

Help our clients navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices

Are you close to completing a bachelor / master's in science, Information Technology, or a related quantitative discipline, eager to dive into the world of Artificial Intelligence and Data? Our AI & Data team is on the lookout for passionate, innovative minds ready to explore the vast possibilities of AI and data analytics. As a trainee with us, you will embark on a journey of learning and discovery, gaining hands-on experience in shaping the future of technology. Join us to transform your academic knowledge into real-world impact, and kickstart your career in one of the most exciting and fast-evolving fields today.

About The Position

We are looking for Trainees starting September 2025 for a 12-month program. Top performers may be offered full-time roles as Business Analysts or Consultants right after the program or within a year of finishing studies.

How You Can Make An Impact


Work with our clients to modernize their data landscape using next generation cloud-enabled platforms and (Gen)AI technology to deliver high quality actionable insights
Implement large-scale data ecosystems including data management, governance, and the integration of internal and external data
Leverage traditional data visualization and next generation algorithms to generate predictions and insights from structured and unstructured data, and augment decision-making
Jointly develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their objectives ranging from satisfying regulatory requirements to improving customer experience by leveraging the power of modern data stack
Guide clients in executing complex data transformations that have organizational and cultural implications and require data-driven mindset



Who We Are Looking For


You have a strong academic background, preferably with a degree in Science, Information Technology, or another quantitative field
You have a strong drive for excellence and high career ambitions
You have gained first relevant practical data-related and/or consulting-like experience through internships/traineeships and enjoy working methodically and with great attention to detail.
You grasp new concepts quickly and are both client and goal oriented
You can manage multiple activities and are used to work in high pace environment
You‚Äôre fluent English, fluency in German and/or French highly preferred
You show a foundational understanding of at least one of the following disciplines ‚Äì data management, data platforms, data analytics & (Gen)AI
Practical experience with SQL, Python/Spark, GenI, and Cloud Data Platforms is highly beneficial



Your Team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 60+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices.‚ÄØWe specialise in AI & Data ‚Äì empowering clients to harness it for creating human-centric solutions, driving growth and efficiency. Clients benefit from our expertise in data, analytics, modern platforms, and advanced technologies like Generative AI. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Careers at Deloitte. Choose your impact.

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on ‚Äúapply now‚Äù to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates. If you have any questions, please contact Jules at talent@deloitte.ch


We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria; don‚Äôt hold yourself back ‚Äì apply today.



We do not accept applications from recruitment agencies for this position.

Deloitte Consulting AG and Deloitte AG are affiliates of Deloitte NSE LLP, a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee (‚ÄúDTTL‚Äù)

Requisition ID: 17999

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
About Amrize

Amrize (NYSE: AMRZ) is North America's leading building solutions company from foundation to rooftop, with $11.7 billion of revenue in 2024. Across more than 1,000 operational sites, our 19,000 teammates partner with the professional builders of North America to advance how we live. Across our Building Materials and Building Envelope businesses, we offer a broad range of advanced building solutions and iconic brands serving customers in all construction markets from infrastructure and commercial to residential as well as from new build to repair and refurbishment. Amrize is listed on the New York Stock Exchange and the SIX Swiss Exchange.




Amrize. Build your ambition.




About the Role

The Senior Data Scientist is responsible for leading the design, development, and implementation of advanced data models, machine learning algorithms, and statistical analyses.




Responsibilities

Develop End-to-End Data Science Projects: Lead data science initiatives from business exploration and model prototyping to deployment and performance monitoring.
Data Collection and Integration: Collect and integrate data from various sources, including databases, APIs, and cloud platforms, ensuring data quality and integrity.
Data Cleaning and Preprocessing: Clean, preprocess, and validate datasets to ensure they meet quality standards for analysis.
Model Development: Design and develop predictive models and AI systems to optimize manufacturing operations, enable predictive maintenance, and improve supply chain logistics.
Collaboration: Work closely with engineering teams and business stakeholders to ensure that AI/ML solutions are aligned with business objectives and production-ready.
Communication: Effectively communicate insights to both technical and non-technical audiences through reports, visualizations, and dashboards.
Continuous Learning: Stay current with emerging trends, tools, and best practices in data science and artificial intelligence, ensuring that the organization remains on the cutting edge of technology.




Qualifications

Education: Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field (Ph.D. preferred).
Work Experience: Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience in data science or a related field, with expertise in machine learning, statistical analysis, and model deployment.




Required Skills

Strong proficiency in Python and SQL.
Advanced experience with machine learning libraries and frameworks.
Strong knowledge of statistical analysis, machine learning techniques, and experimental design.
Hands-on experience with data wrangling and model development.
Knowledge of cloud platforms and model deployment in different infrastructures.
Excellent problem-solving, communication, and presentation skills.
Ability to work collaboratively with diverse teams to achieve business goals.







Travel Requirements: Occasional travel may be required for business needs, approximately 15%.
