Title: Computer Vision/Machine Learning Engineer (Spatial AI)
Description:
The Reality Labs team at Meta is looking for Computer Vision Engineers to support our engineering teams as we build towards our goal to transform the way people come together to interact, work and play.We explore, develop and deliver cutting-edge technologies that serve as the foundations for the current and future Reality Labs products including VR, AR, smart-glasses, AI assistants, and robotics. We are committed to driving the state-of-the-art forward through relentless innovation. Through ML perception in 2D and 3D, for both primitives (e.g. depth, segmentation, and semantic keypoints) as well as high-level(e.g. shape inference, 3D reconstruction, context/semantic Understanding), our team is focused on taking new technologies from early incubation to the product level while iterating, prototyping, and realizing the human value and new experiences they open up.Do you have a passion for exploring and solving challenging computer vision and machine learning problems? Do you love solving novel problems from first principles, or delivering SOTA technologies into products used by millions of users? Are you always on the lookout for better, faster, and more efficient solutions? Do you want to help build the core technologies that will enable the new products and experiences?The potential to change the world is immense -- and we're just getting started. We encourage you to apply and join us!

Computer Vision/Machine Learning Engineer (Spatial AI) Responsibilities:


Design and development of novel machine learning algorithms to solve computer vision problems in areas such as: Vision-Language Models, Vision Foundation Models, 3D reconstruction, surface reconstruction, or photorealistic rendering, depth estimation, semantic segmentation, 2D and 3D semantic key point detection, or object tracking.
Drive the team's goals and technical direction and to pursue technical opportunities
Lead and collaborate with multidisciplinary engineering and research teams to develop technologies from early exploration and incubation to production.
Develop prototypes for future VR/AR/MR experiences, drive continued development, and integrate robust solutions into products.
Define projects for other engineers to possibly solve and achieve impact based on your direction.


Minimum Qualifications:


MSc degree in Computer Science, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Robotics or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in one or more of the following areas: Deep Learning, Computer Vision, 3D Vision, Robotics, Machine Learning.
Experience developing computer vision algorithms or computer vision infrastructure in C/C++ or Python
Experience in deep learning and PyTorch


Preferred Qualifications:


PhD degree in Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Robotics or related technical field.
Experience with distributed systems or on-device algorithm development
Industry experience working on projects such as: Vision-Language Models, Vision Foundation Models, 3D reconstruction, surface reconstruction, or photorealistic rendering, depth estimation, semantic segmentation, 2D and 3D semantic key point detection, or object tracking.


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today‚Äîbeyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: Graduate Program - Innovation Impact -R&D Data Scientist Chemistry (d/f/m)
Description:
About the Innovation Impact Program Our 18-month Graduate Program starts on October 1st, 2025, at our Henkel Adhesive Technologies Innovation Center in D√ºsseldorf. You will be part of an exciting development journey, where you will receive a permanent contract from day one, relocation support, and hands-on experience across various innovative technologies. Upon completion, you will have the opportunity to transition into global roles within Henkel‚Äôs innovation network.

What You¬¥ll Do


Partner with product developers and application engineers as part of our R&D team in D√ºsseldorf, Germany to understand technologies, data collection processes, and challenges driving the digital transformation within R&D
Design and conduct data analysis projects to identify trends and patterns in formulation data sets, and build and deploy machine learning models to predict formulation performance, stability, and quality
Collaborate closely with R&D colleagues to translate data insights into new formulations, product development decisions, and application processes - optimizing R&D workflows
Develop and maintain data visualization dashboards to effectively communicate insights to technical and business stakeholders
Leverage your digital skillset to drive awareness and application of data-based decision-making and digital tools across R&D
Support the digital transformation of R&D by implementing data-driven workflows for process development and knowledge management


What makes you a good fit


You have recently completed, or are about to complete, a Master‚Äôs or Ph.D. that combines a strong foundation in Chemistry, Engineering, or Materials Science with Data Science, Physics, Computer Science, or a related analytical field‚Äîfor example, a Bachelor‚Äôs in a natural science and a digitally focused Master's, or interdisciplinary studies that enable you to understand both lab-based R&D and data-driven approaches
You bring first hands-on experience with data analysis and modeling in scientific or engineering contexts, and have a strong grasp of statistical methods and machine learning algorithms (e.g., regression, classification)
You are proficient in data tools such as Python or R, DoE software like Minitab or JMP, and data visualization platforms (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Tableau); experience with IoT, finite element analysis (FEA), and computational fluid dynamics (CFD) is a plus
You are interested in working in a laboratory environment, motivated to learn about formulations, product development, and R&D workflows, and keen to apply your skills in a hands-on setting
You enjoy collaborating with non-digital colleagues, and can confidently explain digital tools and data concepts in a simple, practical way to support their daily work
You are interested in growing your career in Henkel‚Äôs global Innovation network, with relocation as one possible path after the program.
Proficiency in English is essential, as you will work in an international environment


Ready to take the next step in your career? Visit our program landing page for full details and apply today.

Some perks of joining Henkel

At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, generations and disabilities. If there are any specific accommodations or adjustments you require for the interview process or your on-site appointment, please inform us, and we'll do our best to accommodate your requests.

Title: Trainee Meteorology & Data Science
Description:
Workload: 80-100%

Are you interested to get started in the evolving energy industry?‚ö°Do you want to explore and learn how meteorology and climate shape the energy markets?

Become part of the Axpo Trainee community! Collaborate with various divisions and gain exciting and in-depth insights into the world of energy. You work in three different teams and build up your network among the whole group.

The perfect start for your future career as a meteorologist! üíØ The traineeship begins on 1st of October 2025 and is limited to 18 months with the option of a permanent position.

What you will do:


Work on different operational and strategic tasks in your assignments and take on responsibility for ongoing projects from day one
Support the meteorology desk üåßÔ∏è in your first assignment with the daily forecasting tasks by compiling and analysing meteorological data for operational reports, with a particular interest in dynamics that are critical to your stakeholders
Develop projects to bring insightful quantifications and visualisations on the weather and climate evolution to drive decision-making in different areas of the company
Perform data analysis with reanalysis data and numerical weather model data in order to improve medium to extended range forecasting capabilities of the meteorology desk of Axpo
Utilize programming languages such as Python to analyse meteorological data and build operational forecasting tools
Assist in identifying patterns and trends in the data relevant to energy forecasting
An international component will be part of your traineeship during the second assignment. Our team in Oslo üåé is looking forward to welcoming you



What you bring & who you are:


Master‚Äôs degree üéì in Meteorology, Atmospheric Science, or a related field (no more than 2 years of post-graduation professional experience)
Good understanding of atmospheric dynamics, knowledge of scientific literature about subseasonal to seasonal (S2S) predictability is a plus
Strong interest in meteorology and its applications in the energy markets
Strong coding skills in either Python, R or Matlab machine learning methods for weather data analysis.
Experience in analysing meteorological datasets, such as reanalysis data, satellite data or numerical weather prediction model data. Experience in hydrology / hydrological modelling is a plus
First work experience as an intern or working student
Great communication skills and high degree of initiative and flexibility
Fluency in English and German, further languages are a plus



About the team:

You will become part of the 18th trainee generation. Meet regularly for several events, whether it‚Äôs lunch or even power plant visits. Take advantage from our internal learning platforms, courses, and other opportunities to shape your skills and expand your network.

The Meteorology team at Axpo is fast moving and innovative, trying to convey probabilistic and statistical views on the future weather developments in Europe and the rest of the World. We collaborate broadly with many groups within the company and carry Axpo‚Äôs exposure to weather on multiple facets of our operations.

You will work in the office in Baden, with the flexibility to work from home as well. The fixed traineeship salary is CHF 86‚Äô000 per year, including several attractive fringe benefits.

Find more details to the traineeship here.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (Computer Vision)
Description:
About the job


Scandit gives people superpowers. Whether enabling delivery drivers to make quicker deliveries, matching a patient with their medication, or allowing retailers to make store operations more efficient, our technology automates workflows. It provides actionable insights to help businesses in a variety of industries. Join us as we continue to expand, grow, innovate, and help take Scandit to the next level.Our newest product, ShelfView, is a machine learning-powered platform for retail that enables real time shelf visibility and empowers more intelligent and efficient store operations. With our scalable smart data capture technology via fixed cameras and mobile devices, retailers are on track to save tens of millions in operating expense and in turn generate tens of million more in value for their customers.We are looking for a new colleague to join the ShelfView team and work on creating digital twins of retail shelves. You will be responsible for evolving our current product by adding new features and optimizing the existing offering. You will work on computer vision and deep learning algorithms to improve shelf recognition beyond state of the art.If these challenges sound interesting to you, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!




What you will do





Driving and solving fine grained product recognition on retail shelves for our customer use cases


Be involved hands on in all phases of end to end quality improvements (defining and tracking metrics, prototyping, testing, integration of existing models, creation of new models, data collection, analysis, debugging)


Stay up to date with the latest research in detection, segmentation and long tailed object recognition


Set direction and identify opportunities to push boundaries of recognition


Mentoring team members on code quality and engineering practices



Who you are


You are an experienced ML engineer who is passionate about building, shipping, and improving machine learning-powered systems. You have a proven track record of delivering state-of-the-art computer vision systems with a cloud component and firsthand experience bringing them from the prototyping stage to production.




You recognize that software development encompasses both technology and human interaction and feel comfortable working independently or on a team. While you stay on top of the state-of-the-art in CV/ML, you value proven technologies and small increments. You are creative and determined to solve real-world problems by thinking outside the box and making an impact. You thrive on tackling open problems, taking ownership, and effectively overcoming obstacles. You pay attention to details and at the same time are able to take pragmatic shortcuts to reach our goals.




In particular, we are excited to hear from you if the following sounds like you:





7+ years of experience solving recognition problems in the industry with a proven track record of launched products


Fluency in Python and another language (e.g. C/C++, Go or Rust)


Experience with relevant machine learning frameworks (Pytorch, Jax, Tensorflow)


Have firsthand experience with cloud-based development (databases, service-oriented architecture, data pipelines)


Skilled in software design, problem-solving, and debugging


Experience in building visual search systems or a retrieval-augmented LLM systems is a plus



Our tech stack



Python 3.11, Pytorch, Django


MySQL and PostgreSQL


AWS, Kubernetes, GitLab CI






What we offer


Here are just some of the reasons why people choose to build their career at Scandit:





We are certified as a ‚ÄúGreat Place to Work‚Äù in 10 countries!


Opportunity to work with world-class sales leaders and SaaS experts


Smart, people-first culture


An attractive individual equity plan in a high growth company¬†


Flexible, office, hybrid or home working


Innovation hackathons for all - not just the techies


Team outings¬†


Festive/end of year all company celebrations¬†


Your birthday off¬†


Learning and development opportunities


Top notch tech pack to enable you to do your most productive work


Brand new optimized-for-hybrid working HQ in Zurich as well as local offices in hotspots London, Tampere, Warsaw, Singapore and Tokyo


As well as specific benefits related to the location you are joining





Who we are




Scandit enables enterprises and consumers to change the way they interact with everyday objects and augment the physical world with real-time data captured by scanning barcodes and recognizing text, objects, and other visual identifiers using smartphones, tablets, wearables, drones and robots.




Scandit‚Äôs mobile data capture platform is built on proprietary computer vision, augmented reality, and machine learning technologies. Companies in industries such as retail, transportation & logistics, manufacturing, and healthcare can use Scandit‚Äôs technology to create and power mobile apps for crucial enterprise workflows like mobile point of sale, mobile shopping, self-checkout, inventory management, and proof of delivery.




Many of the world‚Äôs most innovative and successful companies are benefiting from Scandit‚Äôs enterprise-grade mobile data capture platform, including Sephora, Nissan, DHL, and Levi Strauss & Co.




Scandit was founded by a group of researchers from ETH Zurich and MIT. The company is headquartered in Zurich and is also represented in Boston, London, Warsaw, Tokyo and Tampere. Over the years, our company has evolved into a world-class team of mobile image processing, cloud-computing and ‚ÄúInternet of Things‚Äù experts from around the globe and has most recently also opened an office in Tampere, Finland.




‚ÄúEverybody is welcome here‚Äù - Is a celebrated component of our DNA.




At Scandit we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be a safe space for all.




All qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical [dis]ability or length of time spent unemployed.

  • Brand new optimized-for-hybrid working HQ in Zurich as well as local offices in hotspots London, Tampere, Warsaw, Singapore and Tokyo

  • As well as specific benefits related to the location you are joining


Who we are


Scandit enables enterprises and consumers to change the way they interact with everyday objects and augment the physical world with real-time data captured by scanning barcodes and recognizing text, objects, and other visual identifiers using smartphones, tablets, wearables, drones and robots.


Scandit‚Äôs mobile data capture platform is built on proprietary computer vision, augmented reality, and machine learning technologies. Companies in industries such as retail, transportation & logistics, manufacturing, and healthcare can use Scandit‚Äôs technology to create and power mobile apps for crucial enterprise workflows like mobile point of sale, mobile shopping, self-checkout, inventory management, and proof of delivery.


Many of the world‚Äôs most innovative and successful companies are benefiting from Scandit‚Äôs enterprise-grade mobile data capture platform, including Sephora, Nissan, DHL, and Levi Strauss & Co.


Scandit was founded by a group of researchers from ETH Zurich and MIT. The company is headquartered in Zurich and is also represented in Boston, London, Warsaw, Tokyo and Tampere. Over the years, our company has evolved into a world-class team of mobile image processing, cloud-computing and ‚ÄúInternet of Things‚Äù experts from around the globe and has most recently also opened an office in Tampere, Finland.


‚ÄúEverybody is welcome here‚Äù - Is a celebrated component of our DNA.


At Scandit we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be a safe space for all.


All qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical [dis]ability or length of time spent unemployed.



#engineering

Title: AI Engineer - Computer Vision
Description:
We are looking for a machine learning & computer vision expert to strengthen our team in Zurich.

The goal of this position is to develop and fine-tune state of the art vision and 3D geometric models for scene segmentation and scene understanding.

Requirements

Experience with developing and training state of the art (transformer-based) vision models. Experience with 3D models to operate on point clouds is a plus.

Particularly:


PhD or master's degree in computer vision or machine learning with relevant project experience (e.g. master thesis)
Excellent knowledge of Python, PyTorch and the training of deep neural networks
Hands-on experience in the training and deployment of 2D and 3D segmentation and environment understanding models
Robotics experience is a plus.


We are looking for a person who enjoys working in a team in a very dynamic and fast-moving environment, and who is able and willing to take ownership of projects and decisions.

Benefits

We at Flexion Robotics (flexion.ai) are a young company in Zurich working on the next generation of humanoid robot software to enable robots to perform useful tasks autonomously.

We work dynamically and move fast. The team is still fairly small and every new employee at this stage will have significant ownership of their current project.

We offer a competitive remuneration in the form of a competitive base salary and additional components/benefits depending on the specific role and the experience of the applicant.

Title: Research Scientist
Description:
At Nestl√© Nutrition, our mission is to nurture a Healthier Generation. We aim to achieve this by leading the way in Research and Development of science proven nutrition solutions and by partnering with parents and healthcare professionals around the world. From pre-conception to adulthood, we are widening our reach and opening up new opportunities across the lifelong nutrition journey.

Position Snapshot

Location: Konolfingen (BE), Switzerland

Company: Nestl√© Product & Technology Center (NPTC), Science & Technology

Act. Rate: Full-Time

Type of contract: Permanent contract

What We Offer At Nestl√©

Exciting opportunities to develop your career your way; across different brands, businesses, functions, and regions.

Flexible working arrangements - facilitating creativity and collaboration A culture of respect, with diversity, equity and inclusion at its core. Learn more here.

A dynamic international environment empowering you to learn, develop and grow.

Don‚Äôt hesitate to connect with us during the recruitment process to learn more.

Position Summary

As a Research Scientist you will be investigating innovative product / process concepts through applied research and provide scientific contributions to product / process development projects. You will be mainly working in the field of powdered products, leveraging your technical expertise on dry processing of food powders (e.g. spray drying).

A Day in the Life of a Research Scientist


Plan and execute scientific experiments and projects to develop new concepts of potential business importance
Contribute to project work, e.g. through project management, scientific advice, required analyses and technical assistance
Document and communicate results in reports, presentations, NesTMS etc.
Apply, build and maintain knowledge / expertise in the field of powder science & drying technologies; keep up with developments in aligned research fields, scientific and analytical disciplines
Assess, elaborate, transfer methods (traditional, rapid)
Maintain scientific / analytical network; liaise with other R&D units
Represent NPTC Nutrition / Nestl√© in field of expertise
Provide leadership, focus and motivational support to laboratory team
Integrate and coach collaborators (e.g. lab technicians, apprentices, master students)
Assist Group Manager in recruiting, integrating, coaching and developing people
Assure Good Laboratory Practice and efficient laboratory operation


What Will Make You Successful


Ph.D. in Food Science, Food Engineering (or a related discipline) or equivalent experience in R&D
Several years of experience in managing R&D projects or activities, preferably in the food industry.
Experince on functional properties of food powders and their characterization
Strong knowledge of drying and powder handling technologies.
Excellent scientific / technical know-how in data analysis and visualization
Good understanding of digital tools for research
Fluent in written and spoken English, German is a plus
Good leadership and people management skills, at ease with frequent scope change
Excellent communication skills


Nestl√© is committed to the accessibility of its recruitment process. If you require an adaptation during the recruitment process, please do let us know so we can support you effectively. All information will be treated confidentially.

At Nestl√© Research and Development in Konolfingen near Bern / Switzerland, we develop for Nestl√© worldwide, new products, processes and packaging concepts for a broad range of products of our Nutrition, Dairy, Health Science and Coffee businesses. In addition, we also provide technical assistance to our factories.
Show more

Title: Member of Technical Staff, AI Post Training
Description:
Help us develop and train the cutting-edge models that are served in Copilot.

‚ÄØ

At Microsoft AI, we are on a mission to develop the most cutting-edge algorithms for post-training large language models (LLMs) and ship those models to millions of users using Copilot every day.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

‚ÄØ

The AI Post-Training team at Microsoft AI is responsible for all aspects of post-training the models that we serve in Copilot, including: data collection, building evaluations that are aligned with our product and model capability goals, prototyping new capabilities to make Copilot more powerful, developing new finetuning algorithms to supercharge our models, working with platform and engineering teams to deploy those models, and closing the loop by improving the models with feedback we receive from our users. We work on the bleeding edge and leverage the most powerful pretrained models and algorithms for our needs. We are an interdisciplinary team of engineers and scientists, learning from each other and collaborating to create the best models and products.‚ÄØ

‚ÄØ

We are looking for outstanding individuals excited about contributing to the next generation of models that will transform the field. We are looking for candidates who:‚ÄØ


Are passionate about shipping models into products that users will love‚ÄØ
Will thrive in a highly collaborative, fast-paced environment‚ÄØ
Have a high degree of craftsmanship and pay close attention to details‚ÄØ
Demonstrate a proactive attitude and enthusiasm for exploring new methods and technologies‚ÄØ
Are willing to meaningfully contribute as individuals with multiple responsibilities and can adjust to shifting priorities


Responsibilities


Develop data collection, evaluation, and finetuning methods for models.‚ÄØ
Design hypotheses and experiment plans for rapidly iterating on model performance.‚ÄØ
Prototype new model features and capabilities and collaborate with engineers and researchers across Microsoft AI to make them a reality.‚ÄØ
Collaborate with pretraining and product platform teams to establish good vertical integration and ship models that Copilot users love.‚ÄØ
Embody our culture and values.‚ÄØ


Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND experience in business analytics, data science, software development, data modeling or data engineering work
OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND experience in business analytics, data science, software development, or data engineering work OR equivalent experience.
Expertise in the area of Post-Training AI Models and in applying post-training techniques such as DPO, PPO, or RLHF


#Copilot #MicrosoftAI

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: AI Engineer - Reinforcement Learning
Description:
We are looking for a software engineer to strengthen our reinforcement learning team in Zurich. The goal of this position is the development and deployment of state of the art learning-based controllers in simulation and on real hardware.

Requirements

Hands on experience with robotic hardware, reinforcement learning and dev-ops is required.

Particularly:


PhD or master's degree in robot control or reinforcement learning with relevant project experience (e.g. master thesis)
Good knowledge of Python, PyTorch, C++, ONNX
Experience with dev-op workflows and corresponding tools, including docker and singularity
Good knowledge of ROS, ROS2 and simulation environments
Experience with server infrastructure and cloud deployment


We are looking for a person who enjoys working in a team in a very dynamic and fast-moving environment, and who is able and willing to take ownership of projects and decisions.

Benefits

We at Flexion Robotics (flexion.ai) are a young company in Zurich working on the next generation of humanoid robot software to enable robots to perform useful tasks autonomously.

We work dynamically and move fast. The team is still fairly small and every new employee at this stage will have significant ownership of their current project.

We offer a competitive remuneration in the form of a competitive base salary and additional components/benefits depending on the specific role and the experience of the applicant.

Title: Research Scientist, Paradigms of Intelligence
Description:
Minimum qualifications:


PhD degree in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
One or more scientific publication submissions for conferences, journals, or public repositories.


Preferred qualifications:


Post-doctoral experience.
Experience with first-authored publications in conferences or journals in physics (e.g., Physical Review Letters), programming languages (e.g., PLDI, ICFP), combinatorial optimization, or especially machine learning (e.g., ICLR, ICML, NeurIPS).
Experience with Machine Learning.
Excellent computer programming skills.
Demonstrated expertise relevant to our mission: programming languages theory (e.g., rewriting systems, type systems, functional programming) or physics of complex systems.


About the jobAs an organization, Google maintains a portfolio of research projects driven by fundamental research, new product innovation, product contribution and infrastructure goals, while providing individuals and teams the freedom to emphasize specific types of work. As a Research Scientist, you'll setup large-scale tests and deploy promising ideas quickly and broadly, managing deadlines and deliverables while applying the latest theories to develop new and improved products, processes, or technologies. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new architectures, our research scientists work on real-world problems that span the breadth of computer science, such as machine (and deep) learning, data mining, natural language processing, hardware and software performance analysis, improving compilers for mobile platforms, as well as core search and much more.

As a Research Scientist, you'll also actively contribute to the wider research community by sharing and publishing your findings, with ideas inspired by internal projects as well as from collaborations with research programs at partner universities and technical institutes all over the world.

The team you'll be joining aims to advance the field of artificial intelligence by exploring alternative computational paradigms beyond those currently trending. We aim to deepen our understanding of how complexity emerges in differentiable/non-differentiable automated algorithm discovery methods. We are interested in the design of systems that, starting from a problem description, are capable of producing algorithmic solutions that exhibit compositionality, hierarchical structures, and component reuse.

Responsibilities


Carry out sustained exploratory research.
Review literature, identify key questions, design experiments, and interpret results.
Collaborate in person and remotely; maintain a respectful work environment.
Share ideas verbally and in writing; publish and present work at journals and/or scientific conferences.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
Show more

Title: Data Science Internship / Working Student
Description:
Company Description

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika‚Äôs around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

Job Description

For our Web- & eCommerce Team we are looking for an additional member, who can be a full-time intern as well as staying with us longer term as a part-time working student.

As we have multiple different projects, we are able to offer interesting topics for students who are looking to gain some experience in fields such as; data science and data engineering, business analysis, and other technical fields in order to create business applications and automate processes.

Example Assignments


Functional and semantic similarity modelling for chemical products
Recommendation/ranking algorithms for eCommerce platform
Exposing training materials with interactive chatbots
Website parsing with AI avoiding hallucinations and information loss


What We Offer


Dynamic and fun team
Multicultural environment
Working with senior tech leads
Visibility to IT management if that is perceived motivating
Well defined projects in case school requires formal documentations for credit(s)


Qualifications

Basic understanding of:


at least one programming/scripting language
database technologies and a query language
data engineering and science basics


Soft Skills


Willingness to learn
Enjoyment of problem solving
English language is needed, German/Spanish knowledge is advantage


Additional Information

For insights into what our colleagues say about working at Sika, please click here.

We look forward to your direct online application.

Title: Sr. ML/AI Specialist
Description:
Sr. ML/AI Specialist- Revolutionize DeFi with a Growing Protocol | Zug, Switzerland




Are you ready to shape the future of society with your expertise in Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence? We are seeking a dynamic and entrepreneurial Sr. ML/AI Specialist to join our fast-growing team in Switzerland. This role offers an exciting opportunity to work on innovative projects in the crypto and blockchain sector.




About the Role




As a Sr. ML/AI Specialist, you will conduct deep quantitative analysis to inform capital deployment and investment strategies, as well as support research in risk management, portfolio optimization, and market analysis.

Source, compile, clean, and analyze data across various markets.
Build and develop models to identify trends and patterns.
Implement ML-based approaches for DeFi strategies.
Present findings with effective data visualization.







What Makes You the Ideal Sr. ML/AI Specialist




Minimum 2 years of experience with machine learning and statistical analysis methods.
Strong interest in the cryptocurrency sector, particularly DeFi.
Background in finance or computer/data science with a deep understanding of financial markets.
Proficiency in essential software tools for model implementation; skills in Solidity are a significant asset.







Why You Should Consider This Role - Sr. ML/AI Specialist




Competitive compensation, bonus, and participation opportunities.
Modern working conditions and ample opportunities for personal and professional development.
A supportive team atmosphere with flat hierarchies and a strong entrepreneurial spirit.
Exposure to talented colleagues and clients with unique investment profiles.







If you're self-motivated, disciplined, and detail-oriented, and you thrive in a dynamic environment, apply now for the Sr. ML/AI Specialist position. Be part of a team that adapts traditional portfolio optimization methods to a DeFi yield-focused context and collaborate with a software team to automate data collection and analysis processes.







Take Your Career to the Next Level as a Sr. ML/AI Specialist! Apply Today!

Description:
On behalf of our client Hilo by Aktiia, and as part of an exclusive mandate, we are seeking a versatile and motivated individual to join their pioneering team as a




MACHINE LEARING ENGINEER 100%




Company Overview

Hilo by Aktiia believes, the key to improving cardiovascular health is to provide patients and physicians with a deeper understanding of the blood pressure pattern. Before Hilo, it was not possible to monitor cardiovascular health at scale.

They are an early-stage, venture-backed start-up that has raised over $96M from top-tier investors in Europe and the United States. They have developed and brought to market the world's first continuous blood pressure monitor. Their technology is based on 18 years of research by their founders at the prestigious Swiss Center for Electronics and Microtechnology (CSEM). Hilo by Aktiia's solution has been validated through extensive clinical trials and received a CE Mark as a Class IIa medical device under MDR leading to commercial access of approximately 43 countries worldwide.







Responsibilities

Design, develop, optimize, and document innovative AI models for blood pressure estimation from optical signals
Analyze model limitations and devise strategies to enhance performance, addressing key challenges
Collaborate and communicate effectively with cross-functional teams to solve complex technical problems




Your profile

M.Sc or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, or a relevant field
2+ years of industry experience applying Deep Learning techniques, ideally in a highly regulated field (medtech, banking, ‚Ä¶)
Experience in developing, fine-tuning, and evaluating neural network architectures on large-scale datasets
Experience in performing verification and validation (V&V) activities of developed models
Experience in deploying machine learning models in a production environment
Deep understanding of statistical learning, CNNs, and RNNs
Proficiency in Python and machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, etc.) + AWS
Experience in medical signal processing or time series analysis is a plus
Strong communication skills in English (both written and spoken)
Creative and hands-on approach to problem-solving
Comfortable working in a multidisciplinary, multicultural, and diversity-oriented team
Highly organized and meticulous in code development and documentation, ensuring thorough traceability and clarity in compliance with medical device industry standards
Based in Switzerland, with a valid Swiss work permit




Benefits

Pension
Competitive compensation package based on experience
Flexible work location (hybrid work schedule)







Are you passionate in solving problems with visionaries and innovative approaches?




Then Flurin Schwager looks forward to receiving your application documents or your call.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
At Pixel Plus, we are pioneering AI-driven solutions, combining Azure AI Foundry with open-source technologies to build scalable, cutting-edge AI platforms tailored to our clients' needs. Our AI-powered platform enables rapid development and deployment of AI applications.




We are now looking for an AI Engineer to join our team and help shape the future of AI in our projects.




üöÄ Join us and drive innovation at the intersection of proprietary and open-source AI!


Tasks



Design, develop, and optimize AI models by combining Azure AI Foundry with open-source technologies, LLMs, and machine learning services.


Enhance and scale our AI Platform, integrating RAG, LLMs, and ML pipelines into real-world applications.


Develop AI agents leveraging Azure AI Foundry and open-source frameworks, enabling a ChatGPT-like experience tailored to different industries.


Work closely with engineering teams to implement best practices in AI deployment, security, and performance.


Collaborate with clients to understand business needs and transform them into scalable AI-driven solutions.


Ensure seamless integration with Azure services and open-source tools, including Cognitive Services, OpenAI models, and vector databases.



Requirements



Proven experience working with Azure AI Foundry and open-source AI ecosystems.


Strong background in LLM fine-tuning, RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), and AI-driven application development.


Proficiency in Python, ML frameworks, and cloud-native AI solutions.


Hands-on experience with Azure Cognitive Services, OpenAI APIs, and vector search.


Experience in AI security, MLOps, and deploying scalable AI solutions.


Ability to troubleshoot and optimize AI models for performance and accuracy.


Fluent in English (German is a plus).



Benefits



Exciting AI-driven projects with a strong focus on innovation.


Flexible work environment (remote or hybrid options).


Opportunity to lead AI initiatives in a fast-growing company.


Competitive salary & benefits.


Collaboration with AI & cloud experts shaping the future of AI.





Pixel Plus is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Full Stack Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
What You'll Do

Build, optimize, and deploy end-to-end ML pipelines for computer vision, NLP, and multi-agent LLM systems, ensuring scalability for real-time and high-load applications.
Design microservice-based backend architectures using FastAPI, Flask, PostgreSQL, and MongoDB, with robust API integrations (REST, asynchronous workflows) and Redis caching.
Industrialize AI solutions using NVIDIA Triton, vLLM, and ONNX Runtime, focusing on model quantization, low-latency inference, and seamless integration with hardware/embedded systems.
Architect Kubernetes-managed deployments with CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions), containerization (Docker), and infrastructure monitoring (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK Stack).
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business requirements into production-grade AI solutions for industries like healthcare, manufacturing, and public services.
Develop hardware-software integrations for robotic systems, including sensor fusion, microcontroller programming, and simulations.







What You Bring

Bachelor's/Master's degree in Software Development, Robotics, or Electrical Engineering with a focus on Computer Vision, AI, or Control Systems.
5+ years of hands-on experience in ML/CV Engineering: PyTorch, TensorFlow, OpenCV, Vision Transformers (ViT), and fine-tuning models for domain-specific tasks (e.g., object detection, text analytics).
5+ years of hands-on experience in Backend Development: Microservice design, both relational and NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, MongoDB), and API security (OAuth2, JWT).
5+ years of hands-on experience in Production Deployment: Kubernetes, Docker, and optimization of high-concurrency systems (1,000+ users).
Proficiency in embedded systems: Experience with microcontrollers programming, and sensor integration.
Practical knowledge of control theory (PID, state-space) and physics-based modeling (Lagrangian/Hamiltonian dynamics for robotic systems). Proficiency in Gazebo/ROS2 is a plus.
Software architecture expertise: Design of scalable, fault-tolerant systems with clear service boundaries and async communication. Practical experience of designing micro-service architecture applications.
Fluent English (written/spoken); German or French is a plus.
Proactive problem-solver with a track record of delivering optimized, business-impactful solutions on tight deadlines.







Why Join Us

Work on high-impact AI projects with direct applications in healthcare, manufacturing, and public services
Flexible working hours, workplace Aarau, Switzerland
Young, ambitious, and collaborative team culture
Competitive compensation package depending on experience
Access to continuous learning and cutting-edge tools in ML and software engineering

Title: Research Engineer, Applied AI
Description:
As a research engineer you will work on improving kapa‚Äôs ability to answer harder and harder technical questions. Check out Docker‚Äôs documentation for a live example of what kapa is (look for the ‚ÄúAsk AI‚Äù button).

In This Role, You Will


Work directly with the founding team and our software engineers.
Work on and do research in state-of-the-art retrieval and search techniques.
Work on and deploy machine learning models as part of RAG.
Continuously improve our quality evaluation frameworks to enable robust iteration.
Keep up with the latest developments in the space and see how they can be applied.
Design and run experiments.


In addition to the founding team, you'll have support from a number of leading academics in the field that are all close advisors (incl. Douwe Kiela, author of the original RAG paper).

You May Be a Good Fit If You Have


A Master's/ PhD degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Statistics or a related field.
A detailed understanding of machine learning, deep learning (including LLMs) and natural language processing.
Hands-on experience in training, fine-tuning and deploying large language models.
Have prior experience working with vector databases, search indices, or other data stores for search and retrieval use cases.
Significant experience building evaluation systems for LLMs or search.
Familiarity with various information retrieval techniques, such as lexical search and dense vector search.
The ability to work effectively in a fast in a environment where things are sometimes loosely defined.
Want to learn more about machine learning research.
This is neither an exhaustive nor necessary set of attributes. Even if none of these apply to you, but you believe you will contribute to kapa.ai, please reach out.

Title: Research Scientist, GenAI Speech (London)
Description:
The GenAI Speech team is looking for a Research Scientist (Speech and Language). The GenAI Speech team works on large language models (LLMs) with native supporting for processing, understanding and generating of audio and speech as a modality besides others such as text or vision. As part of this, we are leveraging knowledge in areas like speech/audio encoders/tokenizer, pre-training, post-training, (online) reinforcement learning, LLM alignment, multimodal modelling, speech and audio processing, speech recognition (ASR), speech synthesis (TTS), and multilingual modelling. Our work is focused on advancing core technologies to drive and advance core product experiences at Meta such as Meta AI which is available on e.g. RayBan Meta glasses or within WhatsApp.

Research Scientist, GenAI Speech (London) Responsibilities:


Lead research to advance audio and speech technologies using large language models that can be applied to a wide area of Meta production use cases.
Work towards long-term ambitious research and production goals, while identifying intermediate milestones.
Influence progress of relevant research communities by producing publications.


Minimum Qualifications:


Ph.D. and established track record of leading and/or contributing to influential research, such as as evidenced by high-impact publications at peer-reviewed AI conferences (e.g. Interspeech, ICASSP, ASRU, SLT, NeurIPS, CVPR, ICML, ICLR, ICCV, ACL)
Experience in generative AI research, especially in building and optimising large language models for areas of audio/ speech processing and understanding, computer vision and/or natural language understanding.
Experience communicating research for public audiences of peers, as well as non-technical audiences.
Experience in leading theoretical and empirical research and for answering questions with research.
Experience in training, fine-tuning, and/or experimenting with foundation models beyond black-box use.
Familiarity with one or more deep learning frameworks (e.g. pytorch, tensorflow, ‚Ä¶).


Preferred Qualifications:


2+ years of work experience in a faculty, industry, or government research position with primary emphasis on AI research.
Experience in building large language models for audio/ speech processing, understanding, and generation.
Experience driving original scholarship in collaboration with a team.
Experience in developing and debugging in C/C++, Python, PyTorch.


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today‚Äîbeyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: Trainee Meteorology & Data Science
Description:
Workload: 80-100%

Are you interested to get started in the evolving energy industry?‚ö°Do you want to explore and learn how meteorology and climate shape the energy markets?

Become part of the Axpo Trainee community! Collaborate with various divisions and gain exciting and in-depth insights into the world of energy. You work in three different teams and build up your network among the whole group.

The perfect start for your future career as a meteorologist! üíØ The traineeship begins on 1st of October 2025 and is limited to 18 months with the option of a permanent position.

What you will do:


Work on different operational and strategic tasks in your assignments and take on responsibility for ongoing projects from day one
Support the meteorology desk üåßÔ∏è in your first assignment with the daily forecasting tasks by compiling and analysing meteorological data for operational reports, with a particular interest in dynamics that are critical to your stakeholders
Develop projects to bring insightful quantifications and visualisations on the weather and climate evolution to drive decision-making in different areas of the company
Perform data analysis with reanalysis data and numerical weather model data in order to improve medium to extended range forecasting capabilities of the meteorology desk of Axpo
Utilize programming languages such as Python to analyse meteorological data and build operational forecasting tools
Assist in identifying patterns and trends in the data relevant to energy forecasting
An international component will be part of your traineeship during the second assignment. Our team in Oslo üåé is looking forward to welcoming you



What you bring & who you are:


Master‚Äôs degree üéì in Meteorology, Atmospheric Science, or a related field (no more than 2 years of post-graduation professional experience)
Good understanding of atmospheric dynamics, knowledge of scientific literature about subseasonal to seasonal (S2S) predictability is a plus
Strong interest in meteorology and its applications in the energy markets
Strong coding skills in either Python, R or Matlab machine learning methods for weather data analysis.
Experience in analysing meteorological datasets, such as reanalysis data, satellite data or numerical weather prediction model data. Experience in hydrology / hydrological modelling is a plus
First work experience as an intern or working student
Great communication skills and high degree of initiative and flexibility
Fluency in English and German, further languages are a plus



About the team:

You will become part of the 18th trainee generation. Meet regularly for several events, whether it‚Äôs lunch or even power plant visits. Take advantage from our internal learning platforms, courses, and other opportunities to shape your skills and expand your network.

The Meteorology team at Axpo is fast moving and innovative, trying to convey probabilistic and statistical views on the future weather developments in Europe and the rest of the World. We collaborate broadly with many groups within the company and carry Axpo‚Äôs exposure to weather on multiple facets of our operations.

You will work in the office in Baden, with the flexibility to work from home as well. The fixed traineeship salary is CHF 86‚Äô000 per year, including several attractive fringe benefits.

Find more details to the traineeship here.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (Computer Vision)
Description:
About the job


Scandit gives people superpowers. Whether enabling delivery drivers to make quicker deliveries, matching a patient with their medication, or allowing retailers to make store operations more efficient, our technology automates workflows. It provides actionable insights to help businesses in a variety of industries. Join us as we continue to expand, grow, innovate, and help take Scandit to the next level.Our newest product, ShelfView, is a machine learning-powered platform for retail that enables real time shelf visibility and empowers more intelligent and efficient store operations. With our scalable smart data capture technology via fixed cameras and mobile devices, retailers are on track to save tens of millions in operating expense and in turn generate tens of million more in value for their customers.We are looking for a new colleague to join the ShelfView team and work on creating digital twins of retail shelves. You will be responsible for evolving our current product by adding new features and optimizing the existing offering. You will work on computer vision and deep learning algorithms to improve shelf recognition beyond state of the art.If these challenges sound interesting to you, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!




What you will do





Driving and solving fine grained product recognition on retail shelves for our customer use cases


Be involved hands on in all phases of end to end quality improvements (defining and tracking metrics, prototyping, testing, integration of existing models, creation of new models, data collection, analysis, debugging)


Stay up to date with the latest research in detection, segmentation and long tailed object recognition


Set direction and identify opportunities to push boundaries of recognition


Mentoring team members on code quality and engineering practices



Who you are


You are an experienced ML engineer who is passionate about building, shipping, and improving machine learning-powered systems. You have a proven track record of delivering state-of-the-art computer vision systems with a cloud component and firsthand experience bringing them from the prototyping stage to production.




You recognize that software development encompasses both technology and human interaction and feel comfortable working independently or on a team. While you stay on top of the state-of-the-art in CV/ML, you value proven technologies and small increments. You are creative and determined to solve real-world problems by thinking outside the box and making an impact. You thrive on tackling open problems, taking ownership, and effectively overcoming obstacles. You pay attention to details and at the same time are able to take pragmatic shortcuts to reach our goals.




In particular, we are excited to hear from you if the following sounds like you:





7+ years of experience solving recognition problems in the industry with a proven track record of launched products


Fluency in Python and another language (e.g. C/C++, Go or Rust)


Experience with relevant machine learning frameworks (Pytorch, Jax, Tensorflow)


Have firsthand experience with cloud-based development (databases, service-oriented architecture, data pipelines)


Skilled in software design, problem-solving, and debugging


Experience in building visual search systems or a retrieval-augmented LLM systems is a plus



Our tech stack



Python 3.11, Pytorch, Django


MySQL and PostgreSQL


AWS, Kubernetes, GitLab CI






What we offer


Here are just some of the reasons why people choose to build their career at Scandit:





We are certified as a ‚ÄúGreat Place to Work‚Äù in 10 countries!


Opportunity to work with world-class sales leaders and SaaS experts


Smart, people-first culture


An attractive individual equity plan in a high growth company¬†


Flexible, office, hybrid or home working


Innovation hackathons for all - not just the techies


Team outings¬†


Festive/end of year all company celebrations¬†


Your birthday off¬†


Learning and development opportunities


Top notch tech pack to enable you to do your most productive work


Brand new optimized-for-hybrid working HQ in Zurich as well as local offices in hotspots London, Tampere, Warsaw, Singapore and Tokyo


As well as specific benefits related to the location you are joining





Who we are




Scandit enables enterprises and consumers to change the way they interact with everyday objects and augment the physical world with real-time data captured by scanning barcodes and recognizing text, objects, and other visual identifiers using smartphones, tablets, wearables, drones and robots.




Scandit‚Äôs mobile data capture platform is built on proprietary computer vision, augmented reality, and machine learning technologies. Companies in industries such as retail, transportation & logistics, manufacturing, and healthcare can use Scandit‚Äôs technology to create and power mobile apps for crucial enterprise workflows like mobile point of sale, mobile shopping, self-checkout, inventory management, and proof of delivery.




Many of the world‚Äôs most innovative and successful companies are benefiting from Scandit‚Äôs enterprise-grade mobile data capture platform, including Sephora, Nissan, DHL, and Levi Strauss & Co.




Scandit was founded by a group of researchers from ETH Zurich and MIT. The company is headquartered in Zurich and is also represented in Boston, London, Warsaw, Tokyo and Tampere. Over the years, our company has evolved into a world-class team of mobile image processing, cloud-computing and ‚ÄúInternet of Things‚Äù experts from around the globe and has most recently also opened an office in Tampere, Finland.




‚ÄúEverybody is welcome here‚Äù - Is a celebrated component of our DNA.




At Scandit we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be a safe space for all.




All qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical [dis]ability or length of time spent unemployed.

Title: AI Engineer - Computer Vision
Description:
We are looking for a machine learning & computer vision expert to strengthen our team in Zurich.

The goal of this position is to develop and fine-tune state of the art vision and 3D geometric models for scene segmentation and scene understanding.

Requirements

Experience with developing and training state of the art (transformer-based) vision models. Experience with 3D models to operate on point clouds is a plus.

Particularly:


PhD or master's degree in computer vision or machine learning with relevant project experience (e.g. master thesis)
Excellent knowledge of Python, PyTorch and the training of deep neural networks
Hands-on experience in the training and deployment of 2D and 3D segmentation and environment understanding models
Robotics experience is a plus.


We are looking for a person who enjoys working in a team in a very dynamic and fast-moving environment, and who is able and willing to take ownership of projects and decisions.

Benefits

We at Flexion Robotics (flexion.ai) are a young company in Zurich working on the next generation of humanoid robot software to enable robots to perform useful tasks autonomously.

We work dynamically and move fast. The team is still fairly small and every new employee at this stage will have significant ownership of their current project.

We offer a competitive remuneration in the form of a competitive base salary and additional components/benefits depending on the specific role and the experience of the applicant.

Title: MLOps Engineer
Description:
At Akkodis Switzerland, we're looking for a skilled MLOps Engineer to join our team and play a key role in shaping and supporting cutting-edge AI infrastructure. You‚Äôll work across architecture, security, automation, and FinOps‚Äîdriving smart, reliable solutions from design to deployment.




üöÄ What You‚Äôll Be Doing

As a Technical Operations Specialist to support MLOps , you will:

Lead security assessments and ensure policy compliance.
Optimize and monitor cloud infrastructure costs (FinOps).
Support MLOps architecture and contribute to system design and documentation.
Conduct PoCs and evaluate new technologies.
Break down technical tasks and support project planning.




üõ†Ô∏è What You Bring

Solid experience with cloud platforms (ideally AWS) and cost optimization strategies.
Strong proficiency in Python, plus hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, and CI/CD tools like GitLab and ArgoCD.
Familiarity with security concepts (Zero Trust, SAML, OAuth).
Experience with monitoring/observability tools like Grafana, ELK, or Datadog.
Experience with MLOps tools like Kubeflow or KServe is a plus




üí° Why Join Us?

At Akkodis, you'll collaborate with forward-thinking engineers, data scientists, and architects on impactful AI initiatives. We offer a dynamic environment where your ideas matter, and your growth is supported.
Ready to make an impact at the intersection of AI and infrastructure?
Let‚Äôs build the future together.

Title: Research Scientist
Description:
At Nestl√© Nutrition, our mission is to nurture a Healthier Generation. We aim to achieve this by leading the way in Research and Development of science proven nutrition solutions and by partnering with parents and healthcare professionals around the world. From pre-conception to adulthood, we are widening our reach and opening up new opportunities across the lifelong nutrition journey.

Position Snapshot

Location: Konolfingen (BE), Switzerland

Company: Nestl√© Product & Technology Center (NPTC), Science & Technology

Act. Rate: Full-Time

Type of contract: Permanent contract

What We Offer At Nestl√©

Exciting opportunities to develop your career your way; across different brands, businesses, functions, and regions.

Flexible working arrangements - facilitating creativity and collaboration A culture of respect, with diversity, equity and inclusion at its core. Learn more here.

A dynamic international environment empowering you to learn, develop and grow.

Don‚Äôt hesitate to connect with us during the recruitment process to learn more.

Position Summary

As a Research Scientist you will be investigating innovative product / process concepts through applied research and provide scientific contributions to product / process development projects. You will be mainly working in the field of powdered products, leveraging your technical expertise on dry processing of food powders (e.g. spray drying).

A Day in the Life of a Research Scientist


Plan and execute scientific experiments and projects to develop new concepts of potential business importance
Contribute to project work, e.g. through project management, scientific advice, required analyses and technical assistance
Document and communicate results in reports, presentations, NesTMS etc.
Apply, build and maintain knowledge / expertise in the field of powder science & drying technologies; keep up with developments in aligned research fields, scientific and analytical disciplines
Assess, elaborate, transfer methods (traditional, rapid)
Maintain scientific / analytical network; liaise with other R&D units
Represent NPTC Nutrition / Nestl√© in field of expertise
Provide leadership, focus and motivational support to laboratory team
Integrate and coach collaborators (e.g. lab technicians, apprentices, master students)
Assist Group Manager in recruiting, integrating, coaching and developing people
Assure Good Laboratory Practice and efficient laboratory operation


What Will Make You Successful


Ph.D. in Food Science, Food Engineering (or a related discipline) or equivalent experience in R&D
Several years of experience in managing R&D projects or activities, preferably in the food industry.
Experince on functional properties of food powders and their characterization
Strong knowledge of drying and powder handling technologies.
Excellent scientific / technical know-how in data analysis and visualization
Good understanding of digital tools for research
Fluent in written and spoken English, German is a plus
Good leadership and people management skills, at ease with frequent scope change
Excellent communication skills


Nestl√© is committed to the accessibility of its recruitment process. If you require an adaptation during the recruitment process, please do let us know so we can support you effectively. All information will be treated confidentially.

At Nestl√© Research and Development in Konolfingen near Bern / Switzerland, we develop for Nestl√© worldwide, new products, processes and packaging concepts for a broad range of products of our Nutrition, Dairy, Health Science and Coffee businesses. In addition, we also provide technical assistance to our factories.
Show more
HTML:
At Nestl√© Nutrition, our mission is to nurture a Healthier Generation. We aim to achieve this by leading the way in Research and Development of science proven nutrition solutions and by partnering with parents and healthcare professionals around the world. From pre-conception to adulthood, we are widening our reach and opening up new opportunities across the lifelong nutrition journey.

Position Snapshot

Location: Konolfingen (BE), Switzerland

Company: Nestl√© Product & Technology Center (NPTC), Science & Technology

Act. Rate: Full-Time

Type of contract: Permanent contract

What We Offer At Nestl√©

Exciting opportunities to develop your career your way; across different brands, businesses, functions, and regions.

Flexible working arrangements - facilitating creativity and collaboration A culture of respect, with diversity, equity and inclusion at its core. Learn more here.

A dynamic international environment empowering you to learn, develop and grow.

Don‚Äôt hesitate to connect with us during the recruitment process to learn more.

Position Summary

As a Research Scientist you will be investigating innovative product / process concepts through applied research and provide scientific contributions to product / process development projects. You will be mainly working in the field of powdered products, leveraging your technical expertise on dry processing of food powders (e.g. spray drying).

A Day in the Life of a Research Scientist

  • Plan and execute scientific experiments and projects to develop new concepts of potential business importance
  • Contribute to project work, e.g. through project management, scientific advice, required analyses and technical assistance
  • Document and communicate results in reports, presentations, NesTMS etc.
  • Apply, build and maintain knowledge / expertise in the field of powder science & drying technologies; keep up with developments in aligned research fields, scientific and analytical disciplines
  • Assess, elaborate, transfer methods (traditional, rapid)
  • Maintain scientific / analytical network; liaise with other R&D units
  • Represent NPTC Nutrition / Nestl√© in field of expertise
  • Provide leadership, focus and motivational support to laboratory team
  • Integrate and coach collaborators (e.g. lab technicians, apprentices, master students)
  • Assist Group Manager in recruiting, integrating, coaching and developing people
  • Assure Good Laboratory Practice and efficient laboratory operation

What Will Make You Successful

  • Ph.D. in Food Science, Food Engineering (or a related discipline) or equivalent experience in R&D
  • Several years of experience in managing R&D projects or activities, preferably in the food industry.
  • Experince on functional properties of food powders and their characterization
  • Strong knowledge of drying and powder handling technologies.
  • Excellent scientific / technical know-how in data analysis and visualization
  • Good understanding of digital tools for research
  • Fluent in written and spoken English, German is a plus
  • Good leadership and people management skills, at ease with frequent scope change
  • Excellent communication skills

Nestl√© is committed to the accessibility of its recruitment process. If you require an adaptation during the recruitment process, please do let us know so we can support you effectively. All information will be treated confidentially.

At Nestl√© Research and Development in Konolfingen near Bern / Switzerland, we develop for Nestl√© worldwide, new products, processes and packaging concepts for a broad range of products of our Nutrition, Dairy, Health Science and Coffee businesses. In addition, we also provide technical assistance to our factories.

Title: Member of Technical Staff, AI Post Training
Description:
Help us develop and train the cutting-edge models that are served in Copilot.

‚ÄØ

At Microsoft AI, we are on a mission to develop the most cutting-edge algorithms for post-training large language models (LLMs) and ship those models to millions of users using Copilot every day.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

‚ÄØ

The AI Post-Training team at Microsoft AI is responsible for all aspects of post-training the models that we serve in Copilot, including: data collection, building evaluations that are aligned with our product and model capability goals, prototyping new capabilities to make Copilot more powerful, developing new finetuning algorithms to supercharge our models, working with platform and engineering teams to deploy those models, and closing the loop by improving the models with feedback we receive from our users. We work on the bleeding edge and leverage the most powerful pretrained models and algorithms for our needs. We are an interdisciplinary team of engineers and scientists, learning from each other and collaborating to create the best models and products.‚ÄØ

‚ÄØ

We are looking for outstanding individuals excited about contributing to the next generation of models that will transform the field. We are looking for candidates who:‚ÄØ


Are passionate about shipping models into products that users will love‚ÄØ
Will thrive in a highly collaborative, fast-paced environment‚ÄØ
Have a high degree of craftsmanship and pay close attention to details‚ÄØ
Demonstrate a proactive attitude and enthusiasm for exploring new methods and technologies‚ÄØ
Are willing to meaningfully contribute as individuals with multiple responsibilities and can adjust to shifting priorities


Responsibilities


Develop data collection, evaluation, and finetuning methods for models.‚ÄØ
Design hypotheses and experiment plans for rapidly iterating on model performance.‚ÄØ
Prototype new model features and capabilities and collaborate with engineers and researchers across Microsoft AI to make them a reality.‚ÄØ
Collaborate with pretraining and product platform teams to establish good vertical integration and ship models that Copilot users love.‚ÄØ
Embody our culture and values.‚ÄØ


Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND experience in business analytics, data science, software development, data modeling or data engineering work
OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND experience in business analytics, data science, software development, or data engineering work OR equivalent experience.
Expertise in the area of Post-Training AI Models and in applying post-training techniques such as DPO, PPO, or RLHF


#Copilot #MicrosoftAI

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: R&D
HTML:
Due to our high growth and commitment to technology, Medacta is seeking for a C++ Software Developer to join our development team. This team is responsible for creating preoperative planning software for orthopaedic surgeries. Specifically, we are seeking a developer to contribute to our desktop application for surgical planning. The ideal candidate will have experience in developing applications in C++ and specific expertise in QT, VTK, and ITK technologies, with a strong inclination toward 3D graphics. You will join a talented, young and dynamic software development team.

The candidate will be responsible for managing the following activities:

  • develop, test, and maintain C++ software applications focused on medical device functionality and surgical planning tools;
  • collaborate with regulatory, marketing, and project management teams to ensure alignment with industry regulations, product requirements, and project goals;
  • ensure compliance with medical device software standards (e.g., IEC 62304) and maintain thorough documentation for regulatory audits and submissions;
  • conduct code reviews and enforce best practices for code quality, documentation, and testing within the team;
  • contribute to risk analysis and usability assessments, working closely with cross-functional teams to address and mitigate potential issues;
  • provide technical support during clinical evaluations and product testing, addressing feedback and making iterative improvements;
  • continuously monitor and integrate relevant updates to software libraries, technologies, and industry standards to enhance software performance and security.

Hard Skills

The resource should also have the following skills:

  • bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in computer science, Software Engineering;
  • experience in medical device software development, with a proven record of designing or supporting software that meets regulatory requirement;
  • extensive experience with C++ programming, including hands-on experience with the Qt framework and CMake build systems;
  • strong background in 3D rendering software development;
  • solid understanding of linear algebra, including reference systems and transformation matrices;
  • proficiency with version control systems, particularly Git, and experience in a collaborative development environment;
  • experience with containerization and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker) to support deployment and testing processes;
  • knowledge of QML for the development of intuitive and responsive user interfaces;
  • experience working in cross-functional teams and managing input from regulatory, marketing, and project management perspectives.

Soft Skills

  • strong skills in planning, execution, and resource management across multiple projects;
  • excellent interpersonal and communication skills;
  • passion for writing great, simple, clean and efficient code;
  • awareness of the importance of the teamwork.

What We Offer

  • permanent contract;
  • flexible working hours;
  • carpooling organized by Medacta;
  • incentives for mobility by public transport;
  • advantageous conventions;
  • growth opportunity, working in a continuously improving and expanding environment;
  • annual salary review linked to performance and professional development;
  • continuous training.

Medacta International is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.
