Title: Cientista de Dados - J√∫nior
Description:
Introduction

In this role you will join IBM Consulting via our world class Associate Program for university hires. As an Associate at IBM Consulting you will have the opportunity to work with a diverse range of clients worldwide. Our clients' technical and business needs are constantly evolving. We're hiring inspired, talented individuals, who believe no problem is too big to solve.

We focus on your professional development through ongoing learning, mentorship, development of technical skills, and continuous personal growth, all grounded in a culture of coaching and career advancement. If you see yourself as someone who never stops learning and who wants to unleash your potential, the IBM Consulting Associates Program is for you.

A career in IBM Consulting is rooted by long-term relationships and close collaboration with clients across the globe.

You‚Äôll work with visionaries across multiple industries to improve the hybrid cloud and AI journey for the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Your ability to accelerate impact and make meaningful change for your clients is enabled by our strategic partner ecosystem and our robust technology platforms across the IBM portfolio; including Software and Red Hat.

Curiosity and a constant quest for knowledge serve as the foundation to success in IBM Consulting. In your role, you‚Äôll be encouraged to challenge the norm, investigate ideas outside of your role, and come up with creative solutions resulting in ground breaking impact for a wide network of clients. Our culture of evolution and empathy centers on long-term career growth and development opportunities in an environment that embraces your unique skills and experience.

Your Role And Responsibilities

Are you passionate about data, technology and innovation? Do you want to take the first steps in your Data Science career, working on real projects that impact the business? Come and join our team!

As a junior data scientist, you will contribute to the development and adjustment of machine learning models, experimenting with different supervised and unsupervised algorithms. You will work on exploratory data analysis, identifying patterns and trends, and collaborating with data engineers to ensure the proper preparation of datasets.

You will also participate in the creation of proofs of concept (PoCs) to validate the technical feasibility of the models, documenting results and analyzing metrics such as precision, recall and F1-score. In addition, you will support the transition of models to production, ensuring reproducibility and alignment with project needs.

Responsibilities


Developing and adjusting machine learning models to solve business challenges.
Perform exploratory analysis to identify patterns and trends in data.
Collaborating with data engineers to prepare and validate datasets.
Participating in the creation of PoCs and documenting model results and metrics.
Assisting in the transition of models to production, ensuring reproducibility and alignment with project objectives.


Required Technical And Professional Expertise


Experience in data science, machine learning or related areas.
Knowledge of Python for data analysis and modeling.
Notions of statistics, probability and machine learning fundamentals.
Familiarity with cloud resources for data (Azure, AWS or GCP), especially Azure Machine Learning.
Desire to learn and evolve in a collaborative and innovative environment.


Preferred Technical And Professional Experience


Experience or interest in tools such as Azure Cognitive Services, Azure ML AutoML, Azure Container Instances, Azure Databricks and Azure Synapse Analytics.
Knowledge of deploying models and monitoring in a cloud environment.
Experience in analyzing model performance metrics (precision, recall, F1-score).

Title: Data Scientist SR I Performance
Description:

Title: Data Scientist (DS)
Description:
Global leader in lightweight and sustainable construction, Saint-Gobain designs, manufactures, and distributes materials and services for the construction and industrial markets. Its integrated solutions for renovation, lightweight construction, and decarbonization of the construction and industry sectors are developed through a continuous innovation process and promote sustainability and performance.




Want to be part of this team?




Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in areas such as Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or related fields.
Advanced English proficiency.
Intermediate Spanish proficiency




Required Knowledge:

Proficiency in Python and SQL for data processing, analysis, and model development.
Proficiency in descriptive and inferential statistics to analyze data and draw insights.
Expertise in building and deploying predictive models, including regression, classification, clustering, time series, and Natural Language Processing (NLP).




Desirable Knowledge:

Generative AI: Large Language Models (LLM), Fine Tuning, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), and Agents.
Knowledge of cloud platforms, particularly Azure.
Familiarity with MLOps concepts and practices.
Familiarity with industrial automation systems, including SCADA, IoT, and PLC systems.
Knowledge of cybersecurity concepts is a plus.




Main Activities:

Structure, clean, and analyze data, providing insights into business problems.
Develop and validate predictive and prescriptive machine learning models.
Build web applications and APIs to integrate machine learning algorithms into operational systems.
Manage project lifecycle stages, applying AGILE and CRISP-DM methodologies.
Promote data-driven culture in the organization through events, workshops, and training sessions.
Replicate and industrialize previous projects for application in similar plants or areas, tailoring solutions as needed.
Continuously seek opportunities to learn new tools and technologies that can solve business challenges.

Title: Banco de Talentos (Data Scientist Internship, Brazil - BCG X)
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures‚Äîand business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We‚Äôre a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world‚Äôs most complex problems. Leveraging BCG‚Äôs global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

We are seeking strong candidates with advanced analytics experience to start an exciting consultant career within BCG X. We are looking for profiles with a background in any area related to predictive analytics, machine learning, optimization/operations as well as risk. BCG X offers a unique opportunity to join a vibrant team of data scientists applying the most advanced analytics techniques in a rewarding environment.

What You'll Bring

Education & Experience


Bachelor‚Äôs degree with excellent academic achievements in a field linked to computer science, applied mathematics, statistics, machine learning, or related data centric areas - Expected graduation between December 2025 and December 2026.
Relevant internships or industry/consulting previous experience
Experience in core analytics methods (e.g. Machine Learning, Optimization, Deep Learning, etc.)
Fluency in at least one scripting language (e.g. Python, R)
Deep technical and data science expertise, strong passion for data science topics
Excellent analytical skills and strategic thinking, creative problem solver
Strong interpersonal credibility, reliability, and service mentality, high ethical standards
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in Portuguese and English


Technical competencies


Experience in core analytics methods (e.g. Machine Learning/Deep Learning, Optimization/Operational Research, Geoanalytics, Predictive Modeling, Autonomous Agents, Network Analysis, etc‚Ä¶)
Familiarity with a broad base of analytics tools (Data management; Analytics platforms / Programming ‚Äì e.g. Python, R ; Data Visualization, etc‚Ä¶)
Experience in applied analytics for business problem solving/experience building analytical solutions


Additional info

#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

Title: Software Engineer, Early Career
Description:
Please submit your resume in English - we can only consider applications submitted in this language.

Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Belo Horizonte, State of Minas Gerais, Brazil; S√£o Paulo, State of S√£o Paulo, Brazil.Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent practical experience.
1 year of experience with software development in one or more programming languages (e.g., Python, C, C++, Java, JavaScript).


Preferred qualifications:


Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science, or a related technical field.
Experience developing accessible technologies.
Ability to start in 2025


About The Job

Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google‚Äôs needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

With your technical expertise you will manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables. You will design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions.

Google is an engineering company at heart. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on users around the world. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, social to local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

Responsibilities


Write product or system development code.
Participate in, or lead design reviews with peers and stakeholders to decide amongst available technologies.
Review code developed by other developers and provide feedback to ensure best practices (e.g., style guidelines, checking code in, accuracy, testability, and efficiency).
Contribute to existing documentation or educational content and adapt content based on product/program updates and user feedback.
Triage product or system issues and debug/track/resolve by analyzing the sources of issues and the impact on hardware, network, or service operations and quality.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Why join us

Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises ‚Äî including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass ‚Äî use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.

Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We‚Äôre committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.

Data at Brex

Our Scientists and Engineers work together to make data ‚Äî and insights derived from data ‚Äî a core asset across Brex. But it's more than just crunching numbers. The Data team at Brex develops infrastructure, statistical models, and products using data. Our work is ingrained in Brex's decision-making process, the efficiency of our operations, our risk management policies, and the unparalleled experience we provide our customers.

What You‚Äôll Do

As a Data Scientist focused on Product Analytics, you will work closely with Product, Engineering, and Customer Success teams to understand the interactions between product engagement, customer retention, and overall customer growth. Your work will be instrumental in shaping product decisions by uncovering insights into how customers interact with Brex‚Äôs platform, identifying opportunities to refine the product experience, optimize user workflows, and introduce impactful changes that increase long-term customer value and drive sustainable revenue growth.

The ideal candidate has experience leveraging product intuition and advanced analytics to understand customer behavior, measure product impact on revenue retention and growth, and derive insights through causal inference and predictive modeling. They should also have a strong ability to translate data insights into actionable recommendations for product and business teams.

Where you‚Äôll work

This role will be based in our Sao Paulo office. You must be willing to work in office at least 2 days per week on Wednesday and Thursday, starting the week of September 1st, 2025. when we open our Sao Paulo office. Employees will be able to work remotely for up to 4 weeks per year.

Responsibilities


Develop and apply data-driven methodologies to analyze customer behavior, retention trends, and product adoption, focusing on how product changes impact long-term customer value.
Design and implement predictive models, causal inference methods, as well as experimentation strategies to measure and optimize the effect of product changes on customer growth and engagement.
Partner with Product, Engineering, and Customer Success teams to identify key opportunities for improving customer engagement and long-term retention.
Collaborate with Data Engineering to build scalable data pipelines that support product analytics and reporting.
Clearly communicate findings and strategic recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


Requirements


Master‚Äôs degree or Ph.D. in Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related quantitative field.
3+ years of experience in a data science, analytics, or related role focused on product analytics.
Strong experience with SQL and Python (or R) for data analysis and modeling.
Proficiency in A/B testing methodologies, causal inference, and predictive modeling.
Ability to translate complex data insights into strategic business recommendations.
Familiarity with BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker) and data visualization best practices.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment.
English proficiency/fluency, both written and spoken (note: interviews will be conducted in English).


Bonus Points


Experience working in B2B SaaS or fintech.
Experience in developing frameworks to measure feature adoption and identifying product opportunities that drive customer lifetime value.
Familiarity with product analytics tools (e.g., Amplitude, StatSig).


Location


Must be working in Brazil at the start of role


Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a brex.com domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Specialist
Description:
We are seeking a Process Improvement Specialist with a focus on Artificial Intelligence to work in a Financial Services Infratech company. This professional will be responsible for leading automation and optimization initiatives across regulatory, operational, and technological processes, applying AI in a highly critical, regulated environment focused on data security, integrity, and availability.

Responsibilities:


Map and optimize core processes in financial infrastructure (e.g., asset registration, transaction settlement, participant onboarding, collateral validation).
Identify operational bottlenecks and propose AI-driven solutions (RPA, NLP, machine learning, OCR, etc.).
Collaborate with technology, information security, and compliance teams to implement secure and regulation-compliant automations.
Conduct feasibility studies for AI applications in areas such as anti-money laundering (AML), risk management, transaction monitoring, and data reconciliation.
Develop KPIs and reports to measure process performance and the impact of implemented improvements.
Document processes and automations according to internal audit and regulatory standards.
Participate in agile squads focused on innovation and operational efficiency.


Requirements:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Business Administration, Data Science, Information Technology, or related fields.
Proven experience in process improvement in regulated or critical environments (banks, fintechs, exchanges, clearinghouses, etc.).
Hands-on experience with AI tools and automation platforms (e.g., Python, SQL, Power BI, UiPath, Alteryx, Automation Anywhere).
Familiarity with operational controls, compliance, and information security.
Strong analytical skills and understanding of data flows in financial environments.
Familiarity with agile and continuous improvement methodologies (Lean, BPMN, Scrum, etc.).


Preferred:


Experience with payment systems, registries, clearinghouses, or institutions authorized by the Central Bank.
Knowledge of AI governance frameworks, AML regulations, Open Finance, or data protection laws (LGPD/GDPR).
Certifications in Lean Six Sigma, RPA development, or related areas.


What We Offer:


Opportunity to work in a mission-critical environment with direct impact on the national financial system.
Challenging projects using cutting-edge AI and automation technologies.
Multidisciplinary team and innovation-driven culture.
Career development program and ongoing learning opportunities.
Competitive benefits package.

Title: Data Scientist, Credit
Description:
Why join us

Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises ‚Äî including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass ‚Äî use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.

Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We‚Äôre committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.

Data at Brex

Our Scientists and Engineers work together to make data‚Äîand insights derived from data‚Äîa core asset across Brex. But it's more than just crunching numbers. The Data team at Brex develops infrastructure, statistical models, and products using data. Our work is ingrained in Brex's decision-making process, the efficiency of our operations, our risk management policies, and the unparalleled experience we provide our customers.

What You‚Äôll Do

As a Data Scientist, Credit, you will partner closely with our Credit, Enterprise Risk, and Data Science teams to develop analytical frameworks that inform underwriting policies and credit risk strategies. Your work will directly support our Chief Risk Officer in executing a targeted loss rate while ensuring sustainable growth for our credit offerings. You will leverage data science techniques to enhance our credit risk assessment, optimize lending decisions, and refine our risk-based pricing models. Your insights will play a critical role in aligning risk management with business strategy and regulatory considerations.

The ideal candidate has experience in credit risk modeling, underwriting analytics, and quantitative risk assessment. They should have strong business acumen, deep familiarity with credit products, and the ability to communicate technical insights to non-technical stakeholders.

Where you‚Äôll work

This role will be based in our Sao Paulo office. You must be willing to work in office at least 2 days per week on Wednesday and Thursday, starting the week of September 1st, 2025. when we open our Sao Paulo office. Employees will be able to work remotely for up to 4 weeks per year.

Responsibilities


Develop analytical frameworks and risk models to inform underwriting decisions and credit policy optimization.
Analyze loss rate trends, credit performance, and portfolio risk dynamics to drive strategy adjustments.
Collaborate with Credit and Enterprise Risk teams to establish data-driven risk appetite frameworks and lending criteria.
Work closely with our Credit Risk Machine Learning team to improve risk-scoring methodologies and loss forecasting models.
Support pricing and limit-setting strategies through quantitative analysis of risk-adjusted returns.
Design and evaluate tests to policy changes to measure the impact of credit risk strategies on financial performance.


Requirements


Master‚Äôs degree or Ph.D. in Statistics, Economics, Finance, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field.
3+ years of experience in credit risk analytics, underwriting strategy, or related data science roles in lending or financial services.
Strong experience with SQL and Python (or R) for data analysis and modeling.
Proficiency in credit risk modeling techniques, including logistic regression, scorecard development, and loss forecasting.
Familiarity with credit bureau data, alternative data sources, and regulatory risk considerations.
Ability to synthesize complex analyses into actionable business insights and communicate findings to stakeholders.
Experience with experimentation and causal inference methodologies.
English proficiency/fluency, both written and spoken (note: interviews will be conducted in English).


Bonus Points


Experience working in B2B SaaS or fintech, particularly in a lending environment.
Familiarity with risk-based pricing models and financial modeling techniques.
Experience working with credit decisioning systems and automated underwriting workflows.
Knowledge of regulatory frameworks such as CECL, Basel II/III, or stress testing methodologies.


This role offers a unique opportunity to shape the future of credit risk strategy at Brex while working with a world-class data and risk management team. If you are passionate about using data science to drive better lending decisions, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Location


Must be working in Brazil at the start of role


Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a brex.com domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.

As a Data Scientist, Credit, you will partner closely with our Credit, Enterprise Risk, and Data Science teams to develop analytical frameworks that inform underwriting policies and credit risk strategies. Your work will directly support our Chief Risk Officer in executing a targeted loss rate while ensuring sustainable growth for our credit offerings. You will leverage data science techniques to enhance our credit risk assessment, optimize lending decisions, and refine our risk-based pricing models. Your insights will play a critical role in aligning risk management with business strategy and regulatory considerations.

The ideal candidate has experience in credit risk modeling, underwriting analytics, and quantitative risk assessment. They should have strong business acumen, deep familiarity with credit products, and the ability to communicate technical insights to non-technical stakeholders.

Where you‚Äôll work

This role will be based in our Sao Paulo office. You must be willing to work in office at least 2 days per week on Wednesday and Thursday, starting the week of September 1st, 2025. when we open our Sao Paulo office. Employees will be able to work remotely for up to 4 weeks per year.

Responsibilities

  • Develop analytical frameworks and risk models to inform underwriting decisions and credit policy optimization.
  • Analyze loss rate trends, credit performance, and portfolio risk dynamics to drive strategy adjustments.
  • Collaborate with Credit and Enterprise Risk teams to establish data-driven risk appetite frameworks and lending criteria.
  • Work closely with our Credit Risk Machine Learning team to improve risk-scoring methodologies and loss forecasting models.
  • Support pricing and limit-setting strategies through quantitative analysis of risk-adjusted returns.
  • Design and evaluate tests to policy changes to measure the impact of credit risk strategies on financial performance.

Requirements

  • Master‚Äôs degree or Ph.D. in Statistics, Economics, Finance, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field.
  • 3+ years of experience in credit risk analytics, underwriting strategy, or related data science roles in lending or financial services.
  • Strong experience with SQL and Python (or R) for data analysis and modeling.
  • Proficiency in credit risk modeling techniques, including logistic regression, scorecard development, and loss forecasting.
  • Familiarity with credit bureau data, alternative data sources, and regulatory risk considerations.
  • Ability to synthesize complex analyses into actionable business insights and communicate findings to stakeholders.
  • Experience with experimentation and causal inference methodologies.
  • English proficiency/fluency, both written and spoken (note: interviews will be conducted in English).

Bonus Points

  • Experience working in B2B SaaS or fintech, particularly in a lending environment.
  • Familiarity with risk-based pricing models and financial modeling techniques.
  • Experience working with credit decisioning systems and automated underwriting workflows.
  • Knowledge of regulatory frameworks such as CECL, Basel II/III, or stress testing methodologies.

This role offers a unique opportunity to shape the future of credit risk strategy at Brex while working with a world-class data and risk management team. If you are passionate about using data science to drive better lending decisions, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Location

  • Must be working in Brazil at the start of role

Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a brex.com domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.

Title: Cientista Dados Aplicados
Description:
Company Description

Syngenta Seeds is one of the world's largest seed developers and producers for farmers, commercial growers, retailers and small seed companies. Syngenta seeds improve crop quality and yield. High quality seeds ensure better and more productive crops, which is why farmers invest in them. Advanced seeds help mitigate risks such as disease and drought and allow farmers to grow food using less land, less water and fewer inputs.

Syngenta Seeds brings growers more vigorous, strong and resilient plants, including innovative hybrid varieties and biotech crops that can thrive even in challenging growing conditions.

Syngenta Seeds is based in the United States.

Job Description

Job title: Data scientist (S√£o Paulo or Uberl√¢ndia)

Scope: Product Development Global

We are looking for a highly skilled and proactive scientist with solid experience in data science applied to the agriculture sector, especially in plant breeding, genomic prediction, environmental modelling, and product advancement and placement. The ideal candidate is not only technically strong, but also business-driven, capable of translating business needs into analytical solutions, and communicating results in a clear and actionable way to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

The Data Scientist will play a strategic role in identifying high-impact opportunities, prioritizing projects based on value and feasibility, and ensuring the successful communication and delivery of data science outcomes across the organization.


Participation in the development and implementation of global environmental characterization and modeling tools to support product advancement and placement
Collaborate with regional business and technical stakeholders to drive a data and insight-driven trialing network and product placement strategy
Knowledge transfer across technical teams, increasing data science fluency within the organization
Data visualizations to deliver your results and drive business insights, using dashboards and visual analytics tools, such as Power BI, Tableau, R-Shiny, or Qlik Sense.
Cloud-native model deployment using services such as AWS SageMaker, Azure ML, or GCP Vertex AI.
Well-documented APIs and microservices for consumption and integration of machine learning outputs.
Clear technical documentation and reproducible workflows to support research and cross-team collaboration.
Performance reports and continuous improvement recommendations based on model evaluation and business feedback.
Effective business storytelling: translate complex analytical results into strategic insights for leadership and functional teams.
Project impact evaluations to prioritize initiatives and allocate resources efficiently.
Translate complex business questions into data science problems, delivering actionable insights and measurable results.
Collaborate with agronomists, breeders, data scientists, product managers, and tech teams to define project goals and success metrics.
Evaluate project feasibility and business impact, providing input for prioritization and strategic decision-making.
Ensure transparent communication of deliverables and timelines, aligning with business stakeholders and leadership.
Foster a collaborative, insight-driven culture, bridging the gap between technical and functional areas.


Qualifications

Education:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in agronomy, statistics, biotechnology, science and technology, computer science, computer engineering, or related fields.
Master‚Äôs or PhD (preferred) in genetics, quantitative genetics, plant breeding, statistics, bioinformatics, data science or another relevant scientific field.


Technical Skills


Solid experience in at least one of the following: environmental modelling, machine learning for environmental prediction, quantitative genetics, linear mixed models.
Proficient in Python and/or R, experience in ML frameworks is desired. Software version control and best practices using Git is a must.
Solid understanding of SQL/NoSQL databases and data engineering principles
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Experience using of visualization tools: R Shiny, Power BI, Tableau, Qlik Sense.


Soft Skills & Business Acumen


Highly proactive, autonomous, and goal oriented.
Ability to translate technical results into strategic business insights.
Skilled in communicating with leadership and cross-functional teams
Capable of assessing project value and impact to drive prioritization
Comfortable working in fast-paced, multidisciplinary environments


Nice To Have


Experience in agtech, biotech, or agricultural research environments
Publications, patents, or scientific contributions in related areas


Additional Information

Beyond just believing in the power of diversity, Syngenta promotes an inclusive culture that includes differences in all its forms. We believe that the feeling of belonging allows people to become their best version, building an increasingly welcoming and productive environment.

All qualified candidates will be considered for our positions, without distinction of race, gender, age, nationality, or disability.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Location : BAL - SEDE

City : Sao Paulo

State : S√£o Paulo (BR-SP)

Country : Brazil (BR)

Requisition Number : 38806

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Lead Data Scientist with strong expertise in optimization to join our growing team. As Lead Data Scientist, you will be responsible for leading the construction of optimization models to solve business problems and communicate the result to the business stakeholders. You will also be responsible for working with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritize data analytics initiatives. Bunge is committed to operating and thriving in the digital world ‚Äì creating world class agile teams where teammates are empowered and encouraged to collaborate and test and learn to succeed.

At Bunge, people don‚Äôt just come here to work, they come here to grow ‚Äì solving challenges that directly impact the world with a diverse team of thinkers and doers. Most importantly, in all we do we live our values:


Act as One Team by fostering inclusion, collaboration, and respect
Drive for Excellence by being agile, innovative and efficient
Do What's Right by acting safely, ethically, and sustainably


Overview:

The Data Scientist applies strong expertise in machine learning, data mining, and information retrieval to design, prototype, and build next generation advanced analytics engine and services. The data scientist collaborates with translators to define technical problem statement and hypothesis to test; develops efficient and accurate analytical models that mimic business decisions

Responsibilities:


Design, create, test and implement complex models and algorithms that drive analytical solutions throughout the organization
Conduct advanced statistical and other analysis to provide actionable insights, identify trends, and measure performance.
Collaborate with translators and understands business problems to implement scalable and sustainable solutions
Coordinate with MIS, Digital Specialists, and Data Engineers to deliver holistic analytical solutions
Support translators in communicating the design, functioning and output of the analytical models/solutions developed
Ensure timely analysis and testing for regular maintenance of solutions over time


Qualifications/Requirements:


Post graduate degree in STEM field or Bachelor‚Äôs degree with 5-7 years' experience as Data Scientist II
Proficient in programming language like Python or R
Strong foundations in math, analytics and computer science, knowledge of machine learning methods, statistical models, advanced data science programming
Avoid greenhorn mistakes, avoid logical flaws in the models, revisit high-performing systems, write reusable code, build resilient data pipelines in the cloud environment, and prepare immaculate data.
Deep understanding of Database designs. Prior course work is a plus
Creative & innovative thinking; demonstrating drive to solve problems.
Act as a great team player and pitch new ideas, take responsibility to improve code quality and impact.
Has optimization background or at least 3 years of experience with optimization modeling
Has at least 1 year of experience in coordinating technical teams
Proficient in data science, optimization, machine learning, Python, R, SQL, data analysis, analytical skills, teamwork, and communication skills.
Can translate business needs into optimization components (e.g., Constraints, penalties, and objective function
Develop business awareness of use cases and help them to understand the necessary concepts of data science and optimization to ensure better communication across functions.


Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. Founded in 1818, Bunge‚Äôs expansive network feeds and fuels a growing world, creating sustainable products and opportunities for more than 70,000 farmers and the consumers they serve across the globe. The company is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri and has 25,000 employees worldwide who stand behind more than 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging facilities around the world.

Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship, age, disability or military or veteran status, or any other legally protected status. Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

Title: Junior Consultant - Data Scientist (Intern)
Description:
We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di aiutare i clienti, la societ√†, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide pi√π attuali e complesse. KPMG Advisory offre servizi di consulenza alle imprese per affiancarle nella trasformazione del business model, nel miglioramento e nella digitalizzazione dei processi, nell'analisi e nella gestione dei rischi, nonch√© supporto nelle operazioni di finanza straordinaria.

Nel particolare, entrerai a far parte del Team di Lighthouse di Roma.

La Lighthouse √® il centro di eccellenza di KPMG Advisory che offre soluzioni di Data & Analytics sul mercato.

Unendoti al team, svilupperai soluzioni innovative attingendo dalle nostre competenze globali. Combinerai informatica, matematica, statistica e business per creare analisi predittive, presentandole e comunicandole con professionalit√† e competenza. Opererai in un ambiente orientato all'innovazione tecnologica, occupandoti di Data Science, Data Engineering, progettazione delle informazioni e Data visualization. Abbiamo ricevuto riconoscimenti internazionali per quanto riguarda la nostra capacit√† di interpretare e gestire i dati.

Nello specifico, ti occuperai di:


Analizzare e integrare fonti di dati;
Progettare database per scopi analitici;
Progettare KPI e framework di calcolo pi√π efficienti;
Analizzare processi aziendali e progettare modelli di supporto analitico;
Analizzare, progettare e implementare modelli di reportistica e dashboard di monitoraggio;
Implementare soluzioni analitiche, supportare il lancio e gestire la manutenzione delle applicazioni.


Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche

Questa opportunit√† √® perfetta per te se:


Possiedi una Laurea in economia, matematica, ingegneria matematica, statistica, ingegneria informatica, ingegneria gestionale o informatica;
Hai sviluppato la capacit√† di combinare competenze aziendali con competenze IT, inclusa la modellazione dei dati;
Hai sviluppato Interesse per la business intelligence/data analytics;
Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero
Possiedi conoscenza di almeno uno dei seguenti database (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) e hai sviluppato competenze in SQL; la conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione rappresenta un vantaggio.


Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG


Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversit√†
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creativit√† e il lavoro di squadra
Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
Mindset internazionale e progettualit√† innovative
Iniziative incentrate sul benessere psicofisico


Together for Better ‚Äì I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualit√†, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunit√†, integrit√†: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all‚Äôimpegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network ha ottenuto le certificazioni ISO 30415, che attesta la conformit√† del Sistema di Gestione per la Diversit√† e l‚ÄôInclusione, e UNI PdR 125, che certifica la parit√† di genere. All‚Äôinterno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni concrete che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

Unisciti a noi!

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - "GDPR") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.

KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†.

We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Do you want to pursue a profession that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, the company and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory offers consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitisation, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.

Specifically, you will join our Lighthouse team in Milan.

Lighthouse is the KPMG Advisory centre of excellence delivering an array of data & analytics solutions.

Alongside the team, you will develop innovative solutions by drawing on our global expertise. You will combine IT, mathematics, statistics and business knowledge to create predictive analyses, which you will present and communicate in a professional and skilful manner. You will work in a technological innovation-driven environment, working on data science, data engineering, information design and data visualisation. We are internationally renowned for our capacity to interpret and manage data.

Specifically, you will be tasked with:


analysing and integrating data sources;
designing databases for analytical purposes;
designing more efficient KPIs and computing frameworks;
analysing corporate processes and designing analytical support models;
analysing, designing and implementing reporting models and dashboards;
implementing analytical solutions, supporting the launch and overseeing the maintenance of software.


Skills

Come As You Are - Your skills and characteristics

This is the perfect opportunity for you if:


you have a degree in economics, mathematics, mathematical engineering, statistics, computer engineering, management and production engineering or computer science;
you have developed the capacity to combine corporate and IT expertise, as well as data modelling;
you have developed aninterest in business intelligence/data analytics;
you are proficient in English, preferably with study/work experience abroad;
you have knowledge of at least one of the following databases (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) and have developed skills in SQL; knowledge of programming languages is considered an advantage.


Your Future With Us - What you‚Äôll find at KPMG


An inclusive and equitable work environment that respects, encourages and values diversity.
A challenging and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork.
Hybrid work arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance.
Advanced training and development programmes to stay current.
International mindset and innovative projects.
Initiatives focused on mental and physical well-being.


Together for Better ‚Äì Our values and commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect every individual, continuous learning, transparency, commitment to the community and integrity. These are the KPMG values that create an environment that encourages the sharing of ideas and knowledge, so our professionals can achieve their full potential.

As a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network has obtained ISO 30415 certification, which certifies compliance of the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, which certifies gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarised all the concrete actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.

Join us!

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù), as amended. For more information, please see KPMG‚Äôs privacy policy.

KPMG Advisory S.p.A. is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: DATA Scientist
HTML:
Il Gruppo BCC Iccrea √® il maggiore gruppo bancario cooperativo, l‚Äôunico gruppo bancario nazionale a capitale interamente italiano e il quarto gruppo bancario in Italia per attivi. Oggi il Gruppo √® costituito da 114 Banche di Credito Cooperativo, presenti in oltre 1.700 comuni italiani con quasi 2.500 sportelli, e da altre societ√† bancarie, finanziarie e strumentali controllate da BCC Banca Iccrea.


La Capogruppo BCC Banca Iccrea cerca una risorsa da inserire nel ruolo di Data Scientist per l‚ÄôUnit√† Organizzativa HR Operations all‚Äôinterno dell‚ÄôArea Chief Operating Officer per gestire il piano di Intelligenza Artificiale, guidare la prioritizzazione degli use case e definire le scelte metodologiche per lo sviluppo dei modelli, con l‚Äôintento di massimizzare la riusabilit√†, la flessibilit√† e la scalabilit√† delle soluzioni.

La persona verr√† inserita nella sede di Roma.


In particolare, la persona si occuper√† di:


  • Lavorare su progetti all'avanguardia, collaborando con team multidisciplinari per sviluppare soluzioni AI scalabili e trasformative;
  • sviluppare, implementare e ottimizzare modelli di machine learning e intelligenza artificiale per risolvere problemi aziendali complessi;
  • analizzare grandi dataset per estrarre informazioni utili, identificare pattern, tendenze e correlazioni;
  • collaborare con sviluppatori, data scientist e stakeholder interni per integrare soluzioni AI nei processi aziendali esistenti;
  • monitorare le prestazioni dei modelli AI e implementare miglioramenti per garantirne l'efficacia e l'affidabilit√†;
  • ricercare e testare nuove tecnologie AI per mantenere l'azienda al passo con le innovazioni del settore.


Requisiti:


  • Laurea in disciplina ingegneristica/informatica, Statistica, Matematica/fisica;
  • 3-5 anni di esperienza nella gestione di progetti complessi in ambito AI, machine learning e data analysis;
  • ottima conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione come Python, R, e utilizzo dei principali framework di machine learning e deep learning (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn);
  • competenza nell‚Äôuso di strumenti di Business Intelligence (BI) e piattaforme di cloud computing (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud);
  • esperienza con tecnologie big data (ad esempio Hadoop, Spark);
  • requisito preferenziale esperienza in progettazione e sviluppo di modelli AI;
  • buona padronanza delle metodologie di lavoro agile (Scrum, Kanban);
  • competenze avanzate in Excel e PowerPoint per l'analisi e la presentazione dei risultati;
  • capacit√† di applicare tecniche per il tuning e il miglioramento continuo dei modelli AI;
  • ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese ;
  • capacit√† di analisi e sintesi, problem solving, orientamento al cliente, lavoro in gruppo.


In caso di interesse, leggi attentamente l'informativa sulla privacy riportata nell'area Privacy del sito web di BCC Banca Iccrea e invia la tua candidatura allegando il cv. Ti ricordiamo che, ai sensi dell‚Äôart. 111-bis del Codice Privacy, non √® necessaria l‚Äôautorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali presenti nel tuo cv.


La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006 ed √® aperta a candidature di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, et√†, etnia e credo religioso. Il Gruppo BCC Iccrea riconosce che l'attenzione delle diversit√†, l‚Äôinclusione e la tutela dell‚Äôequilibrio fra vita privata e vita professionale siano principi fondamentali di creazione di valore per il Gruppo stesso.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
All‚Äôinterno dell‚Äôarea Strategy, Business Development & Wholebuy Office ‚Äì Competence Development, con sede a Roma, stiamo cercando un Machine Learning Engineer con la passione per la tecnologia e l‚Äôinnovazione e la voglia di giocare un ruolo da protagonista nella trasformazione digitale.

Se ami le sfide, lavori con un mindset data-driven e vuoi contribuire allo sviluppo di soluzioni intelligenti su Google Cloud Platform (GCP), potresti essere la persona che fa per noi.

Chi stiamo cercando

Un Machine Learning Engineer con esperienza nella progettazione, sviluppo e gestione di applicazioni di data science in ambienti cloud, capace di coniugare:


competenze di sviluppo software,
gestione dell‚Äôinfrastruttura cloud,
automazione dei processi di deployment.


Lavorerai a stretto contatto con Data Scientist, Data Analyst e colleghi ITC per creare soluzioni avanzate a supporto dei processi aziendali.

Cosa farai


Industrializzerai soluzioni di Data Science e ML, curando orchestrazione, ambienti, codice e pipeline CI/CD√π
Scriverai codice efficiente, riutilizzabile e in linea con le best practice di ML Governance√π
Collaborerai in team cross-funzionali, contribuendo attivamente alla progettazione di architetture cloud evolute
Promuoverai l‚Äôadozione di pratiche MLOps per aumentare l'efficienza e l'affidabilit√† dei nostri progetti
Integrerai modelli predittivi nelle applicazioni cloud, migliorandone performance e scalabilit√†


Quali sono le competenze chiave


Ottima conoscenza di Python e dei principali framework: Spark (PySpark), Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Pandas

Title: Machine Learning Developer
Description:
Chi siamo

EUforLEGAL Srl, √® una realt√† innovativa nata per offrire soluzioni applicative, servizi e prodotti per il mercato Legaltech, un mercato in grande crescita a livello globale, per l'informatizzazione e automazione delle aree legali di grandi organizzazioni pubbliche e private e di prestigiose law firm.

Abbiamo una pluriennale esperienza d'ambito maturata presso prestigiosi clienti sui processi e tecnologie di Knowledge Management (KM) ed Enterprise Legal Management (ELM) nei sistemi informativi legali.

Le nostre applicazioni di Legal AI generano conoscenza grazie all'utilizzo di modelli di Statistical/Machine Learning, Deep Learning, con l'obiettivo di aumentare la produttivit√†, supportare le decisioni strategiche, offrire un valore aggiunto ai processi aziendali interni e semplificare le attivit√† di gestione delle pratiche legali.




Per il rafforzamento del team AI, siamo alla ricerca di Machine learning Developer che siano parte attiva delle iniziative legate all'intelligenza artificiale all'interno dell'azienda. Le risorse inserite supporteranno l‚Äôazienda nelle strategie di crescita attraverso l‚Äôutilizzo delle moderne tecnologie e Modelli IA per il mercato Legaltech e Regtech.




Descrizione del profilo

Stiamo selezionando brillanti neolaureati/profili Junior in materie STEM con una forte passione vero il mondo della programmazione e dell‚Äôinnovazione. Le risorse saranno inserite all‚Äôinterno di un team di specialisti AI e collaboreranno allo sviluppo e alla messa in produzione di modelli di machine learning, con un focus particolare su progetti/prodotti legati all‚Äôelaborazione del linguaggio naturale (NLP) e alla Generative AI (es. LLM). I candidati ideali avranno una buona esperienza nella programmazione Python e nell'uso dei principali framework e librerie di machine learning.

Le risorse contribuiranno a progetti/prodotti innovativi, implementando e validando soluzioni basate su tecniche avanzate di deep learning e NLP, come Named Entity Recognition (NER), Topic Detecion, Smart Search, e molto altro. Saranno in grado di creare modelli di machine learning su larga scala, sfruttando architetture di deep learning come RNN, BERT, e utilizzando le tecniche pi√π avanzate della Generative AI come il prompt-engineering, il fine-tuning e il retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) sui principali modelli di LLM come LLaMA e GPT.




Requisiti di conoscenza, competenze ed abilit√†

Buona padronanza della programmazione Python e dei framework di machine learning, tra cui:
PyTorch
TensorFlow
Keras
SciKit Learn
Huggingface
Esperienza/conoscenza teorica nella conduzione e realizzazione di progetti NLP (ad esempio: NER, Topic Detecion) e capacit√† di lavorare con modelli su diverse applicazioni.
Buona esperienza nella creazione e messa in produzione di modelli di machine learning
Esperienza/conoscenza teorica delle architetture di deep learning come RNN, BERT, LLMe capacit√† di applicarle ai progetti.
Esperienza/conoscenza teorica di tecniche di prompt-engineering, fine-tuning e RAG su modelli di linguaggio di grandi dimensioni (LLMs) come LLaMA e GPT.
Familiarit√† con pipeline DevOps e MLOps per l'integrazione e la distribuzione continua di modelli ML su larga scala.




Percorso formativo

Laurea Magistrale in ambito scientifico (Data Science, Statistica, Ingegneria, Matematica, Fisica, Informatica, ecc.)
Costituiscono un plus: formazione integrativa, aver conseguito certificazioni di settore e corsi certificati su piattaforme MOOC (es. Coursera, Udemy, ecc.).




Completano il profilo

Capacit√† di lavorare in team e ottime doti relazionali.
Spirito innovativo, curiosit√† e proattivit√†.
Capacit√† di apprendimento rapido e problem-solving pragmatico
Ottime capacit√† di comunicazione e conoscenza dell'inglese




Sede di lavoro: Roma




Perch√® EUforLegal

Crediamo nelle persone e investiamo nella passione, nell' espressione della leadership e del talento. La nostra People Strategy si basa su politiche di inclusione e gender equality, valorizzando ogni forma di individualit√† per favorire l‚Äôespressione del potenziale e arricchire le competenze di tutti.




La ricerca si rivolge a candidature di entrambi i sessi ai sensi della L. 903/77

Title: DATA SCIENTIST ( M/F)
HTML:
Randstad Digital, divisione specializzata nella ricerca e selezione di profili informatici e digital di Randstad Italia, per azienda cliente finale internazionale settore insurance cerca per la sede di Roma un/una:


DATA SCIENTIST (M/F)


L'obiettivo della risorsa sar√† supportare le attivit√† di analisi e gestione dei dati aziendali, costruire modelli predittivi basati su solide basi dati, lavorare sull'innovazione del business e partecipare al processo di delivery del dato interagendo direttamente con il ramo di business.


PRINCIPALI AMBITI DI COMPETENZA:


  • Analisi ed estrazione dei dati tramite SQL e Access (VBA incluso);
  • Elaborazione e gestione dati avanzata tramite Excel (VBS incluso);
  • Supporto alla realizzazione di reportistica con Power BI;
  • Programmazione e analisi dati con R o Python;
  • Gestione database relazionali (Oracle) e NoSQL;
  • Utilizzo di strumenti come SQL Developer e Toad;
  • Studio dei sistemi sorgenti;
  • Gestione delle evolutive di progetto;
  • Elaborazione di query SQL complesse;
  • Costruzione di modelli predittivi e approcci di Machine Learning su attivit√† funzionanti da implementare e migliorare;
  • Gestione e implementazione della reportistica attiva su Oracle: gestione e progettazione dei flussi di cassa, predizioni ed evoluzioni dell'esposizione futura;
  • Costruzione del sistema di reportistica basato su Data Warehouse e relativa gestione;
  • Reporting e visualizzazione dati tramite Power BI;
  • Interfaccia con IT corporate estero, IT bonding e varie branch aziendali.


REQUISITI BASE:


  • Laurea magistrale o triennale in Ingegneria Gestionale, Informatica, Data Science, Scienze Matematiche o Fisica;
  • Esperienza di almeno 1/2 anni in ruoli simili o in attivit√† di Data Scientist;
  • Ottima conoscenza di Microsoft Office (Access e Excel inclusi VBA/VBS);
  • Buona conoscenza di R o Python;
  • Buona padronanza di SQL e PL/SQL;
  • Esperienza con database relazionali (Oracle) e NoSQL;
  • Conoscenza di SQL Developer e Toad;
  • Familiarit√† con strumenti di reporting come Power BI.
  • Conoscenza fluente della lingua Inglese scritta e parlata(Liv. C1);


REQUISITI PREFERENZIALI:

  • Esperienza in ruoli simili di data analysis;
  • Competenze in automazione dei processi di analisi dati;
  • Conoscenza ambienti cloud e big data.


SOFT SKILLS:

  • Precisione, attenzione al dettaglio;
  • Ottime capacit√† analitiche e di problem solving;
  • Buone capacit√† comunicative e relazionali;
  • Proattivit√† e spirito di iniziativa;
  • Capacit√† di lavoro autonomo e per obiettivi.


L'AZIENDA OFFRE:

  • Team dinamico e innovativo;
  • Inserimento diretto con contratto a tempo indeterminato;
  • Smart working, ‚Äã8 giorni a‚Äãl mese fruibili con flessibilit√†;
  • Ral 35k + eventuale valorizzazione sull'esperienza del singolo candidato:
  • ‚Äã(+ welfare e t‚Äãkt da 12,50 al giorno)
  • Possibilit√† di formazione continua.


PER CANDIDARSI: Il CV dovr√† contenere l'autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali ai sensi del GDPR UE 2016/679 e l'attestazione di veridicit√† ai sensi del DPR N.445/2000.

Title: Data Scientist - Consulenza Energetica
HTML:
La tua nuova azienda

La nostra azienda cliente √® una societ√† di consulenza specializzata: copre i servizi operativi, l‚Äôesecuzione del progetto e le competenze tecniche all‚Äôinterno dell‚Äôintera catena del valore nel settore energetico.

Con un approccio unico e trasversale, aiuta i clienti a raggiungere obiettivi impegnativi e trovare nuove opportunit√† di business, guidandoli attraverso la transizione energetica grazie al suo team polivalente di esperti con lunga esperienza sui principali mercati europei nel settore energetico retail e wholesale.


Il tuo nuovo ruolo

A diretto riporto del Senior Data Manager, in ottica di implementazione del team, siamo alla ricerca di una figura di Data Scientist che sia specializzata in forecasting e modelli di ottimizzazione. Nel caso specifico, il candidato di occuper√† di:

  • Supporto alla creazione di modelli di ottimizzazione e algoritmi previsionali short-term per la gestione degli impianti nei mercati spot e dei servizi;
  • Supporto alla definizione delle strategie di arbitraggio e ottimizzazione della produzione degli impianti di generazione (eolici, fotovoltaici, batterie, idroelettrico fluente);
  • Supporto alla creazione di algoritmi per la previsione dei consumi;
  • Supporto per elaborazione e analisi big data (meteo, producibilit√†, prezzi);
  • Supporto per il monitoraggio delle performance degli impianti rinnovabili;
  • Elaborazione report e analisi dei risultati dei modelli implementati.


Di cosa hai bisogno per aver successo

Ricerchiamo figure che abbiamo almeno un‚Äôesperienza di 2 anni in un ruolo similare con le seguenti caratteristiche:

  • Conoscenza di modelli di Machine Learning;
  • Conoscenza di Python (o altro linguaggio di programmazione);
  • Conoscenza di Excel e/o di uno strumento di Business Intelligence (Power BI, Qlik Sense, Tableau)


Cosa avrai in cambio

Entrerai a far parte di una realt√† solida e con grandi ambizioni, guidata da persone con esperienza. Avrai la giusta autonomia per gestire al meglio le attivit√† e guidare nel giusto modo il tuo team.

Sede di lavoro: Roma, rimaniamo per√≤ aperti a valutare l‚Äôinserimento anche sulla sede di Milano


Cosa devi fare ora

Se sei interessato a questa opportunit√†, clicca su "Candidarsi ora" per inviare una copia aggiornata del tuo CV. Se questa opportunit√† non √® in linea con le tue aspettative, ma sei alla ricerca di un nuovo lavoro, visita il nostro sito Internet per scoprirne di nuove. #LI-DNI


I candidati di ambo i sessi, dopo aver visionato l‚Äôinformativa obbligatoria sulla privacy sul sito www.hays.it , sono pregati di inviare il CV in formato Word, indicando il riferimento (Rif. 945253) nonch√© il proprio consenso al trattamento dei dati personali ex D.LGS. 196/03. Aut. Min. N. 13/I/0007145/03.04 del 1 Aprile 2008 a ricerca di un nuovo lavoro, visita il nostro sito Internet per scoprirne di nuove.

Title: Data Scientist - GenAI
Description:
About the job you are considering

Capgemini Global Insights & Data business line is a market leader in the data, platform, and analytics across all regions and across many sectors (including financial services, consumer products, manufacturing & life sciences). Our offerings include end-2-end data integration to cloud platform, complete suite of AI engineering capabilities and a category of sector-based advanced analytics / AI solutions.




The places that you work from day to day will vary according to your role, your needs, and those of the business; it will be a blend of Company offices, client sites, and your home; noting that you will be unable to work at home 100% of the time.




Your Role

We are seeking an experienced and visionary GenAI Specialist to lead our data-driven decision-making processes. This role requires someone with a balance of analytical skills, strategic foresight, and the ability to collaborate effectively across diverse teams. The GenAI Specialist will be instrumental in designing and implementing data strategies that enhance business growth, optimize operations, and foster an inclusive environment of innovation.




Analytical Thinking & Problem Solving: Proven ability to dissect complex problems and provide actionable insights in a timely manner.
Strategic Mindset: Experience developing and executing strategies that are both long-term and adaptable to changing business landscapes.
Collaboration & Communication: Strong interpersonal skills, with an emphasis on listening, empathy, and the ability to translate complex data concepts into understandable terms for non-technical stakeholders.
Leadership & Mentorship: Ability to lead with compassion and clarity, fostering a supportive team environment that values collaboration and diverse perspectives.




Your Skills and Experience

Degree in technical-scientific disciplines; a PhD is considered a plus
NLP tools: NLTK and Spacy for classical NLP, and Huggingface open-source models
Data Science skills: scikit-learn, numpy, pandas
Deep knowledge of approaches to evaluating supervised and unsupervised models, both in NLP and structured data
Excellent knowledge of langchain or llamaindex and experience with production projects
Prompt engineering
Cloud development on at least one major hyperscaler
Pytorch or Tensorflow (excellent knowledge)
Design of cloud architectures and industrialization of AI/GenAI solutions
Participation in commercial and technical estimates for at least one year, participation in at least one tender
Team management tools: Jira, Confluence, Kanban boards, Trello, etc.
Definition, planning, and economic monitoring of projects







Your Security Experience

To be successfully appointed to this role you will need to undergo Baseline Personnel Security Standard checks.

There are no nationality or residency restrictions, although if you have resided outside of the UK within the last 3 years, further checks may be required.

There are other criteria and check required for BPSS, and throughout the recruitment process, you will be asked questions about your security clearance eligibility such as, but not limited to, country of residence and nationality.




Why you should consider Capgemini

Growing clients‚Äô businesses while building a more sustainable, more inclusive future is a tough ask. When you join Capgemini, you‚Äôll join a thriving company and become part of a diverse collective of free-thinkers, entrepreneurs and industry experts. We find new ways technology can help us reimagine what‚Äôs possible. It‚Äôs why, together, we seek out opportunities that will transform the world‚Äôs leading businesses, and it‚Äôs how you‚Äôll gain the experiences and connections you need to shape your future. By learning from each other every day, sharing knowledge, and always pushing yourself to do better, you‚Äôll build the skills you want. You‚Äôll use your skills to help our clients leverage technology to innovate and grow their business. So, it might not always be easy, but making the world a better place rarely is.




About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of ‚Ç¨22.5 billion.

#GetTheFutureYouWant| www.capgemini.com

About the job you are considering

Capgemini Global Insights & Data business line is a market leader in the data, platform, and analytics across all regions and across many sectors (including financial services, consumer products, manufacturing & life sciences). Our offerings include end-2-end data integration to cloud platform, complete suite of AI engineering capabilities and a category of sector-based advanced analytics / AI solutions.


The places that you work from day to day will vary according to your role, your needs, and those of the business; it will be a blend of Company offices, client sites, and your home; noting that you will be unable to work at home 100% of the time.


Your Role

We are seeking an experienced and visionary GenAI Specialist to lead our data-driven decision-making processes. This role requires someone with a balance of analytical skills, strategic foresight, and the ability to collaborate effectively across diverse teams. The GenAI Specialist will be instrumental in designing and implementing data strategies that enhance business growth, optimize operations, and foster an inclusive environment of innovation.


  • Analytical Thinking & Problem Solving: Proven ability to dissect complex problems and provide actionable insights in a timely manner.
  • Strategic Mindset: Experience developing and executing strategies that are both long-term and adaptable to changing business landscapes.
  • Collaboration & Communication: Strong interpersonal skills, with an emphasis on listening, empathy, and the ability to translate complex data concepts into understandable terms for non-technical stakeholders.
  • Leadership & Mentorship: Ability to lead with compassion and clarity, fostering a supportive team environment that values collaboration and diverse perspectives.


Your Skills and Experience

  • Degree in technical-scientific disciplines; a PhD is considered a plus
  • NLP tools: NLTK and Spacy for classical NLP, and Huggingface open-source models
  • Data Science skills: scikit-learn, numpy, pandas
  • Deep knowledge of approaches to evaluating supervised and unsupervised models, both in NLP and structured data
  • Excellent knowledge of langchain or llamaindex and experience with production projects
  • Prompt engineering
  • Cloud development on at least one major hyperscaler
  • Pytorch or Tensorflow (excellent knowledge)
  • Design of cloud architectures and industrialization of AI/GenAI solutions
  • Participation in commercial and technical estimates for at least one year, participation in at least one tender
  • Team management tools: Jira, Confluence, Kanban boards, Trello, etc.
  • Definition, planning, and economic monitoring of projects



Your Security Experience

To be successfully appointed to this role you will need to undergo Baseline Personnel Security Standard checks.

There are no nationality or residency restrictions, although if you have resided outside of the UK within the last 3 years, further checks may be required.

There are other criteria and check required for BPSS, and throughout the recruitment process, you will be asked questions about your security clearance eligibility such as, but not limited to, country of residence and nationality.


Why you should consider Capgemini

Growing clients‚Äô businesses while building a more sustainable, more inclusive future is a tough ask. When you join Capgemini, you‚Äôll join a thriving company and become part of a diverse collective of free-thinkers, entrepreneurs and industry experts. We find new ways technology can help us reimagine what‚Äôs possible. It‚Äôs why, together, we seek out opportunities that will transform the world‚Äôs leading businesses, and it‚Äôs how you‚Äôll gain the experiences and connections you need to shape your future. By learning from each other every day, sharing knowledge, and always pushing yourself to do better, you‚Äôll build the skills you want. You‚Äôll use your skills to help our clients leverage technology to innovate and grow their business. So, it might not always be easy, but making the world a better place rarely is.


About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of ‚Ç¨22.5 billion.

#GetTheFutureYouWant| www.capgemini.com

Title: Artificial Intelligence Space Engineer
Description:
A Joint Venture between Thales (67%) and Leonardo (33%), Thales Alenia Space is a global space manufacturer delivering, for more than 40 years, high-tech solutions for telecommunications, navigation, Earth Observation, environmental management, exploration, science and orbital infrastructures. Thanks to our diversity of skills, talents and cultures, our customers (governments, institutions, space agencies, telecommunications operators), therefore have Space to Connect, Secure & Defend, Observe & Protect, Explore, Travel & Navigate.

Artificial Intelligence Engineering

CANDIDATES THAT WOULD IMPRESS US

PROFILE:

You graduated from an Engineering School with a master‚Äôs degree ‚Äì a PhD is a plus

Your level of experience ranges from junior to advance: you are a student OR/AND you have already occupied one or more positions among the following: Algorithm or Software Engineer, Artificial Intelligence Engineer

You are curious and willing to stay abreast of the latest trends (technical, philosophical, ethical by design)

You enjoy thinking "outside the box" and use your creativity to address complex challenges

You are recognised as a team player and promote collaborative work

You are user centric and want to design components accordingly

COMPETENCIES:

You have in-depth knowledge in mathematics, algorithms, experiment plan, continuous iterations and Agility

You are proficient in one of the following Artificial Intelligence Approches:

Data driven AI, Symbolic AI, Hybrid AI on the Solution

Symbolic Artificial Intelligence and reasoning

Human/machine dialog

Systems Analysis

You understand the norms, laws and standards

You have knowledge of cybersecurity

You can confidently discuss with people from different jobs and background

You master foundational concepts in mathematics/ statistics science and their application to deploy them on Solution studies: statistical modelling, linear algebra, optimisation, machine learning Mathematics and Statistics

NICE TO HAVE:


Working heritage on major satellite Earth Observation and Navigation systems
Simulation by tool such as Matlab & Simulink
adopting modern Agile and DevOps processes
Knowledge of Data analysis and big data technologies
Knowledge of Cloud technologies and architectures
Knowledge of Edgetechnologies
Knowledge of object programming in particular Python (Pyorch) , Java, C ++ and relevant Data Science packages (such as numpy, scipy, scikit-learn, pandas...);
Good knowledge of operating systems;



LIFE AS A THALES ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE ENGINEERING ROLE

As an Artificial Intelligence Engineering Role within Thales, you will:

Design and develop trustworthy artificial intelligence components for various domains

Identify the right cutting-edge Artificial Intelligence technologies (machine learning, symbolic AI, dialogue) and develop the Artificial Intelligence component accordingly

Work on Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Understanding (NLU), and also to design multimodal approaches for Human-Machin Dialog including intention understanding, reasoning and hybrid AI

Work on Machine Learning, causality vs. correlation, and/or other Data driven AI technics such as Random Forest, Evolutionary Algorithms, ‚Ä¶

Work on Symbolic AI, Ontology, Semantic Web, Knowledge based Reasoning, Meta-heuristics, Problem Solving, Operations Research, Decision Making and reasoning

Propose and design approach alternatives

Integrate scientific method into engineering system methodology

Ensure data knowledge and traceability

Ensure continuous technowatch and be aware of the latest trends (technical, philosophical, ethical by design)

Define the system capabilities thanks to a functional, logical and value analysis, describing functions to be performed to meet the real needs of the user in the various scenarii and maximising product value for Customer

YOUR CAREER AT THALES

Future opportunities will allow you to discover other domains or sites. You will be able to evolve and grow your competences in different areas:

Room and attention to personal development

Build your talents in another domain of Thales Group, discovering new products, new customers, new country or go to a more complex Solution

Choose between a technical expertise or a leadership path

Build an international career within a leading Engineering Group

At Thales Alenia Space we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales Alenia Space employing around 8,900 employees in 10 countries with 17 sites in Europe and a plant in the US, our mobility policy enables employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad. Thales Alenia Space sees space as a new horizon, helping to build a better, more sustainable life on Earth #SpaceForLife. Great journeys start here, apply now!

Title: Enterprise Risk - Data Scientist - Fraud - Roma
HTML:
Enterprise Risk - Fraud Data Scientist - Roma

#TELLMEY ‚Äì Cosa dicono di noi

Questi sono i fattori pi√π influenti che hanno spinto colleghe e colleghi a sceglierci nel 2024!

  • Learning and Development: oltre 50 ore all‚Äôanno di formazione per ciascuna persona;
  • Progressione di carriera: solo negli ultimi 12 mesi il 65% delle persone di EY si √® vista riconoscere un avanzamento di carriera;

  • Mobilit√† e opportunit√† internazionali, compresa la possibilit√† di lavorare dall‚Äôestero fino a 20 giorni senza essere in trasferta;
  • Smart working senza giornate prestabilite centralmente.

Qual' √® l‚Äôopportunit√† che offriamo?

All‚Äôinterno della divisione Risk Consulting di EY, ricerchiamo nuove colleghe e colleghi che si uniscano al nostro team Enterprise Risk focalizzato su tematiche di Risk Management, Internal Auditing e Compliance su clienti del settore industriale.
